data.text:
Understood. You want **both approaches simultaneously**:

1. **Full Port**: Binaryen compiled with Cosmopolitan Libc as a universal native binary (build-time, maximum performance)

2. **Meta/WASM**: Binaryen compiled to WASM, running inside redbean's WASM runtime (runtime, sandboxed, self-hosting)

This creates a powerful architecture:

```

Γöé                                                                 Γöé
ΓööΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÿ
```

The meta approach is particularly powerful because:
- **Self-modifying platform**: The SaaS can optimize/compose modules without external tooling
- **Tenant autonomy**: Tenants can customize their downstream builds without accessing your build infrastructure
- **Browser tooling**: Admin UIs could run Binaryen client-side for preview/validation
- **Air-gapped operation**: Fully offline module composition capability

Let me now create the comprehensive strategic plan incorporating both approaches:

{"name": "SaaS Composition Platform Strategy", "overview": "Strategic architecture document for a universal SaaS composition platform using Binaryen (dual native + WASM deployment) with Redbean/Cosmopolitan, enabling multi-tier white-label distribution through IBM and Climb Channel partnerships.", "plan": "# SaaS Composition Platform - Strategic Architecture ## Executive Summary A "CMS for SaaS" platform that treats WebAssembly modules as composable content, enabling multi-tier white-labeling where each downstream tenant receives a unique, optimized binary with only their licensed features compiled in. The platform leverages authorized reseller relationships with IBM PartnerWorld and Climb Channel Solutions to embed enterprise capabilities. --- ## Core Technology Stack ### Dual Binaryen Architecture ```mermaid flowchart TB subgraph buildTime [Build-Time Layer] BinaryenCosmo[binaryen.com
Cosmopolitan Native] BuildPipeline[CI/CD Build Pipeline] ModuleRegistry[Module Registry] end subgraph runtime [Runtime Layer] Redbean[redbean.com
Universal Server] BinaryenWasm[binaryen.wasm
In-Process Optimizer] LuaOrch[Lua Orchestration] SQLite[SQLite State] end subgraph outputs [Deployment Artifacts] TenantBinary[Tenant Binary
White-Labeled] ClientBinary[Client Binary
Sub-Labeled] AgentBinary[Agent Binary
Lightweight] end ModuleRegistry --> BinaryenCosmo BinaryenCosmo --> BuildPipeline BuildPipeline --> TenantBinary TenantBinary --> Redbean BinaryenWasm --> LuaOrch LuaOrch --> ClientBinary LuaOrch --> AgentBinary ``` **Native Binaryen (Cosmopolitan Build)** - Single `binaryen.com` binary runs on Linux, macOS, Windows, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, NetBSD - Full optimization suite: `wasm-merge`, `wasm-opt`, `wasm-ctor-eval`, `wasm-metadce` - Build pipeline use: tenant binary generation, CI/CD integration - Performance target: native speed for heavy optimization passes **WASM Binaryen (Self-Hosted)** - `binaryen.wasm` runs inside redbean's WASM runtime - Enables runtime module composition without external tooling - Tenant-safe: sandboxed execution, no filesystem access - Powers: hot module swapping, dynamic feature activation, client-side preview --- ## Platform Architecture ### Module Registry Structure ``` /registry/ Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ native/ # Your proprietary IP Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ core/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ auth.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ billing.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ api-gateway.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ data-layer.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ verticals/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ payments/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ healthcare/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ lending/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ observability/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ grc/ Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ commerce/ Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ frameworks/ # GRC frameworks Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ soc2-type2.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ hipaa.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ ... Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ ibm/ # IBM resold modules Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ watson/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ assistant.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ discovery.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ nlp.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ watsonx/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ ai.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ governance.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ data.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ security/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ verify.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ guardium.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ qradar.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ sterling/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ oms.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ fulfillment.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ inventory.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ climb/ # Climb Channel resold Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ thales/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ sailpoint/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ snowflake/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ hashicorp/ Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ ... Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ tenants/{tenant-id}/ # Tenant custom modules ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ custom/ ``` ### Composition Engine ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Admin as Tenant Admin participant Portal as Build Portal participant Registry as Module Registry participant Binaryen as Binaryen Engine participant Artifact as Artifact Store Admin->>Portal: Configure build (features, branding, config) Portal->>Registry: Resolve module dependencies Registry-->>Portal: Module list + entitlements Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-merge (combine modules) Binaryen-->>Portal: Merged module Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-ctor-eval (bake config) Note right of Binaryen: Brand, API keys, pricing
compiled into binary Binaryen-->>Portal: Configured module Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-opt -O3 (optimize + DCE) Note right of Binaryen: Dead code elimination
removes unlicensed features Binaryen-->>Portal: Optimized module Portal->>Portal: Package into redbean .com Portal->>Artifact: Store versioned binary Portal-->>Admin: Download link + manifest ``` ### Entitlement Model | Enforcement Type | Mechanism | Use Case | |-----------------|-----------|----------| | **Compile-Time** | Module not included in build | Feature tiers, unlicensed capabilities | | **Bake-Time** | `wasm-ctor-eval` embeds values | Branding, API keys, rate limits | | **Link-Time** | Dead code elimination removes paths | Unused integrations, regional features | | **Run-Time** | License server check | Seat counts, metered usage, expiration | --- ## IBM Integration Strategy ### Phase 1: Watson/watsonx AI Services (Priority) | IBM Product | WASM Module | Integration Pattern | |-------------|-------------|---------------------| | Watson Assistant | `ibm/watson/assistant.wasm` | REST API wrapper, conversation state | | Watson Discovery | `ibm/watson/discovery.wasm` | Document ingestion, NLU queries | | Watson NLP | `ibm/watson/nlp.wasm` | Entity extraction, sentiment | | watsonx.ai | `ibm/watsonx/ai.wasm` | Foundation model inference | | watsonx.governance | `ibm/watsonx/governance.wasm` | Model lineage, bias detection | **Licensing Model**: IBM Cloud Pak consumption-based, passed through to tenants with margin. ### Phase 2: Security Products | IBM Product | WASM Module | Integration Pattern | |-------------|-------------|---------------------| | Verify | `ibm/security/verify.wasm` | OIDC/SAML, MFA, adaptive auth | | Guardium | `ibm/security/guardium.wasm` | Data activity monitoring, audit | | QRadar | `ibm/security/qradar.wasm` | SIEM integration, threat intel | | Trusteer | `ibm/security/trusteer.wasm` | Fraud detection, device fingerprint | ### Phase 3: Sterling Supply Chain | IBM Product | WASM Module | Integration Pattern | |-------------|-------------|---------------------| | Sterling OMS | `ibm/sterling/oms.wasm` | Order orchestration | | Sterling Fulfillment | `ibm/sterling/fulfillment.wasm` | Fulfillment optimization | | Sterling Inventory | `ibm/sterling/inventory.wasm` | Real-time ATP | --- ## Climb Channel Integration Strategy ### Priority Vendors | Category | Vendor | Products | Use Case | |----------|--------|----------|----------| | **Security** | Thales | SafeNet HSM, CipherTrust | Tokenization, encryption | | **Identity** | SailPoint | IdentityNow | Access governance | | **Data** | Snowflake | Data Cloud | Analytics backend | | **DevOps** | HashiCorp | Vault, Terraform | Secrets, IaC | | **Search** | Elastic | Elasticsearch | Log aggregation | | **Compliance** | OneTrust | Privacy, GRC | Consent management | --- ## Multi-Tier White-Label Model ```mermaid flowchart TB subgraph you [Your Corporation - Platform Provider] Core[Core Platform IP] IBM[IBM Modules - Resold] Climb[Climb Modules - Resold] end subgraph tenantA [Tenant A - PayFlow] TenantBuild[Composed Binary] TenantBrand[PayFlow Branding] TenantModules[Custom Modules] end subgraph clientX [Client X - GymPayments] ClientBuild[Sub-Composed Binary] ClientBrand[GymPayments Branding] end subgraph merchant [End Merchant - Downtown CrossFit] MerchantConfig[Merchant Config Baked In] end Core --> TenantBuild IBM --> TenantBuild Climb --> TenantBuild TenantBrand --> TenantBuild TenantModules --> TenantBuild TenantBuild --> ClientBuild ClientBrand --> ClientBuild ClientBuild --> MerchantConfig ``` ### Revenue Flow Per Transaction ``` Merchant pays: $500/month + 2.9% + $0.30/txn ΓöîΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÉ Γöé Your Corporation Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Platform fee: $50/month Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ IBM margin: ~20% on $75 wholesale = $15 Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Climb margin: ~25% on $60 wholesale = $15 Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ Per-txn: 0.05% + $0.01 Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöñ Γöé Tenant "PayFlow" Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Platform margin: $100/month Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Pass-through markup: $35 Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ Per-txn: 0.15% + $0.02 Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöñ Γöé Client "GymPayments" Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Their margin: $185/month Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ Per-txn: 2.70% + $0.27 Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÿ ``` --- ## Six Vertical Platforms ### 1. Payment Processing - **Core**: Ledger, reconciliation, settlement, card processing - **IBM**: Trusteer (fraud), Verify (3DS), ODM (rules) - **Climb**: Thales HSM (tokenization), Plaid (verification) - **Differentiator**: Compiled-in fee structures, per-merchant binaries ### 2. Healthcare EHR - **Core**: Patient demographics, scheduling, clinical notes, billing - **IBM**: Watson Discovery (clinical search), Watson NLP (extraction), Guardium (PHI) - **Climb**: Informatica MDM (patient matching), BigID (PHI discovery) - **Differentiator**: HIPAA compliance baked in, specialty-specific builds ### 3. Embedded Lending - **Core**: Application intake, underwriting, origination, servicing - **IBM**: ODM (decisioning), watsonx.ai (ML models), watsonx.governance (MRM) - **Climb**: Credit bureaus, Plaid, Alloy - **Differentiator**: Underwriting logic compiled in (protected IP), fair lending provable ### 4. Observability/APM - **Core**: Collectors (OTLP, Prometheus), processors, storage, alerting - **IBM**: Instana (APM), Turbonomic (optimization), watsonx AIOps - **Climb**: Elastic, Confluent Kafka, PagerDuty - **Differentiator**: Single-file agent runs anywhere, protocol-specific builds ### 5. Compliance/GRC - **Core**: Control framework, risk register, policy management, reporting - **IBM**: QRadar (SIEM), Guardium (DAM), Process Mining - **Climb**: OneTrust, BigID, SailPoint, Qualys - **Differentiator**: Binary IS the compliance artifact, framework-specific builds ### 6. Headless Commerce - **Core**: Catalog, cart, checkout, orders, pricing, inventory - **IBM**: Sterling (OMS, fulfillment, inventory), Watson (search, assistant) - **Climb**: Algolia, Stripe/Adyen, Avalara, Shippo - **Differentiator**: B2B vs B2C vs subscription builds, vertical-specific --- ## Implementation Phases ### Phase 0: Binaryen Cosmopolitan Port (Foundation) - Port Binaryen C++ codebase to build with Cosmopolitan Libc - Produce `binaryen.com` universal binary - Validate: wasm-merge, wasm-opt, wasm-ctor-eval, wasm-metadce - Secondary: Compile Binaryen to WASM for self-hosting capability ### Phase 1: Composition Engine MVP - Lua orchestration layer in redbean - Module registry (filesystem-based initially, JFrog later) - Build pipeline: merge, configure, optimize, package - CLI and simple web portal ### Phase 2: Tenant Management - Multi-tenant state in SQLite - Entitlement engine (compile-time and runtime) - Build artifact versioning and rollback - Tenant self-service portal ### Phase 3: IBM Watson Integration - Watson Assistant wrapper module - Watson Discovery wrapper module - watsonx.ai inference integration - IBM Cloud Pak licensing integration ### Phase 4: Vertical Pilot - Select one vertical (based on market opportunity) - Build vertical-specific modules - Onboard 1-3 pilot tenants - Validate white-label depth ### Phase 5: Climb Channel Expansion - Integrate priority Climb vendors - Establish volume discount tiers - NFR program for demos - Co-marketing with vendors ### Phase 6: Scale and Replicate - Additional verticals - Geographic expansion (EU data residency) - Enterprise features (SSO, audit, compliance) - Marketplace for third-party modules --- ## Technical Risks and Mitigations | Risk | Impact | Mitigation | |------|--------|------------| | Binaryen Cosmopolitan port complexity | High | Start with C API subset, expand incrementally | | WASM-in-WASM performance | Medium | Use native for heavy ops, WASM for flexibility | | IBM licensing complexity | Medium | Engage IBM partner manager early, clarify OEM terms | | Module size bloat | Medium | Aggressive DCE, modular architecture | | Tenant isolation in shared builds | High | Compile-time separation, no runtime multi-tenancy | --- ## Success Metrics | Metric | Phase 1 Target | Phase 4 Target | |--------|----------------|----------------| | Binary size (base platform) | < 10MB | < 15MB | | Build time (full composition) | < 30s | < 60s | | Supported OS targets | 6 (via Cosmopolitan) | 6 | | Module registry size | 20 modules | 100+ modules | | Active tenants | 0 (internal) | 3-5 pilots | --- ## Next Steps (Immediate) 1. **Binaryen Port Assessment**: Evaluate Binaryen codebase for Cosmopolitan compatibility 2. **IBM PartnerWorld Enrollment**: Initiate/confirm partner tier, access to technical resources 3. **Climb Reseller Agreement**: Establish vendor access for priority integrations 4. **Legal Review**: White-label licensing terms, IP protection for compiled binaries 5. **Architecture Prototype**: Minimal redbean + Lua + WASM composition proof-of-concept", "todos": [{"id": "binaryen-cosmo-assessment", "content": "Assess Binaryen C++ codebase for Cosmopolitan Libc compatibility"}, {"id": "binaryen-wasm-assessment", "content": "Evaluate compiling Binaryen to WASM for self-hosting capability"}, {"id": "ibm-partner-enrollment", "content": "Initiate/confirm IBM PartnerWorld tier and access technical resources"}, {"id": "climb-reseller-agreement", "content": "Establish Climb Channel reseller agreement for priority vendors"}, {"id": "legal-review", "content": "Legal review of white-label licensing and compiled binary IP protection"}, {"id": "redbean-lua-prototype", "content": "Build minimal redbean + Lua + WASM composition proof-of-concept"}]}

toolFormerData.params:
{"plan":"# SaaS Composition Platform - Strategic Architecture ## Executive Summary A "CMS for SaaS" platform that treats WebAssembly modules as composable content, enabling multi-tier white-labeling where each downstream tenant receives a unique, optimized binary with only their licensed features compiled in. The platform leverages authorized reseller relationships with IBM PartnerWorld and Climb Channel Solutions to embed enterprise capabilities. --- ## Core Technology Stack ### Dual Binaryen Architecture ```mermaid flowchart TB subgraph buildTime [Build-Time Layer] BinaryenCosmo[binaryen.com
Cosmopolitan Native] BuildPipeline[CI/CD Build Pipeline] ModuleRegistry[Module Registry] end subgraph runtime [Runtime Layer] Redbean[redbean.com
Universal Server] BinaryenWasm[binaryen.wasm
In-Process Optimizer] LuaOrch[Lua Orchestration] SQLite[SQLite State] end subgraph outputs [Deployment Artifacts] TenantBinary[Tenant Binary
White-Labeled] ClientBinary[Client Binary
Sub-Labeled] AgentBinary[Agent Binary
Lightweight] end ModuleRegistry --> BinaryenCosmo BinaryenCosmo --> BuildPipeline BuildPipeline --> TenantBinary TenantBinary --> Redbean BinaryenWasm --> LuaOrch LuaOrch --> ClientBinary LuaOrch --> AgentBinary ``` **Native Binaryen (Cosmopolitan Build)** - Single `binaryen.com` binary runs on Linux, macOS, Windows, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, NetBSD - Full optimization suite: `wasm-merge`, `wasm-opt`, `wasm-ctor-eval`, `wasm-metadce` - Build pipeline use: tenant binary generation, CI/CD integration - Performance target: native speed for heavy optimization passes **WASM Binaryen (Self-Hosted)** - `binaryen.wasm` runs inside redbean's WASM runtime - Enables runtime module composition without external tooling - Tenant-safe: sandboxed execution, no filesystem access - Powers: hot module swapping, dynamic feature activation, client-side preview --- ## Platform Architecture ### Module Registry Structure ``` /registry/ Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ native/ # Your proprietary IP Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ core/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ auth.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ billing.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ api-gateway.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ data-layer.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ verticals/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ payments/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ healthcare/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ lending/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ observability/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ grc/ Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ commerce/ Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ frameworks/ # GRC frameworks Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ soc2-type2.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ hipaa.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ ... Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ ibm/ # IBM resold modules Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ watson/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ assistant.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ discovery.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ nlp.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ watsonx/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ ai.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ governance.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ data.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ security/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ verify.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ guardium.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ qradar.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ sterling/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ oms.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ fulfillment.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ inventory.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ climb/ # Climb Channel resold Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ thales/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ sailpoint/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ snowflake/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ hashicorp/ Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ ... Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ tenants/{tenant-id}/ # Tenant custom modules ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ custom/ ``` ### Composition Engine ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Admin as Tenant Admin participant Portal as Build Portal participant Registry as Module Registry participant Binaryen as Binaryen Engine participant Artifact as Artifact Store Admin->>Portal: Configure build (features, branding, config) Portal->>Registry: Resolve module dependencies Registry-->>Portal: Module list + entitlements Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-merge (combine modules) Binaryen-->>Portal: Merged module Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-ctor-eval (bake config) Note right of Binaryen: Brand, API keys, pricing
compiled into binary Binaryen-->>Portal: Configured module Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-opt -O3 (optimize + DCE) Note right of Binaryen: Dead code elimination
removes unlicensed features Binaryen-->>Portal: Optimized module Portal->>Portal: Package into redbean .com Portal->>Artifact: Store versioned binary Portal-->>Admin: Download link + manifest ``` ### Entitlement Model | Enforcement Type | Mechanism | Use Case | |-----------------|-----------|----------| | **Compile-Time** | Module not included in build | Feature tiers, unlicensed capabilities | | **Bake-Time** | `wasm-ctor-eval` embeds values | Branding, API keys, rate limits | | **Link-Time** | Dead code elimination removes paths | Unused integrations, regional features | | **Run-Time** | License server check | Seat counts, metered usage, expiration | --- ## IBM Integration Strategy ### Phase 1: Watson/watsonx AI Services (Priority) | IBM Product | WASM Module | Integration Pattern | |-------------|-------------|---------------------| | Watson Assistant | `ibm/watson/assistant.wasm` | REST API wrapper, conversation state | | Watson Discovery | `ibm/watson/discovery.wasm` | Document ingestion, NLU queries | | Watson NLP | `ibm/watson/nlp.wasm` | Entity extraction, sentiment | | watsonx.ai | `ibm/watsonx/ai.wasm` | Foundation model inference | | watsonx.governance | `ibm/watsonx/governance.wasm` | Model lineage, bias detection | **Licensing Model**: IBM Cloud Pak consumption-based, passed through to tenants with margin. ### Phase 2: Security Products | IBM Product | WASM Module | Integration Pattern | |-------------|-------------|---------------------| | Verify | `ibm/security/verify.wasm` | OIDC/SAML, MFA, adaptive auth | | Guardium | `ibm/security/guardium.wasm` | Data activity monitoring, audit | | QRadar | `ibm/security/qradar.wasm` | SIEM integration, threat intel | | Trusteer | `ibm/security/trusteer.wasm` | Fraud detection, device fingerprint | ### Phase 3: Sterling Supply Chain | IBM Product | WASM Module | Integration Pattern | |-------------|-------------|---------------------| | Sterling OMS | `ibm/sterling/oms.wasm` | Order orchestration | | Sterling Fulfillment | `ibm/sterling/fulfillment.wasm` | Fulfillment optimization | | Sterling Inventory | `ibm/sterling/inventory.wasm` | Real-time ATP | --- ## Climb Channel Integration Strategy ### Priority Vendors | Category | Vendor | Products | Use Case | |----------|--------|----------|----------| | **Security** | Thales | SafeNet HSM, CipherTrust | Tokenization, encryption | | **Identity** | SailPoint | IdentityNow | Access governance | | **Data** | Snowflake | Data Cloud | Analytics backend | | **DevOps** | HashiCorp | Vault, Terraform | Secrets, IaC | | **Search** | Elastic | Elasticsearch | Log aggregation | | **Compliance** | OneTrust | Privacy, GRC | Consent management | --- ## Multi-Tier White-Label Model ```mermaid flowchart TB subgraph you [Your Corporation - Platform Provider] Core[Core Platform IP] IBM[IBM Modules - Resold] Climb[Climb Modules - Resold] end subgraph tenantA [Tenant A - PayFlow] TenantBuild[Composed Binary] TenantBrand[PayFlow Branding] TenantModules[Custom Modules] end subgraph clientX [Client X - GymPayments] ClientBuild[Sub-Composed Binary] ClientBrand[GymPayments Branding] end subgraph merchant [End Merchant - Downtown CrossFit] MerchantConfig[Merchant Config Baked In] end Core --> TenantBuild IBM --> TenantBuild Climb --> TenantBuild TenantBrand --> TenantBuild TenantModules --> TenantBuild TenantBuild --> ClientBuild ClientBrand --> ClientBuild ClientBuild --> MerchantConfig ``` ### Revenue Flow Per Transaction ``` Merchant pays: $500/month + 2.9% + $0.30/txn ΓöîΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÉ Γöé Your Corporation Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Platform fee: $50/month Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ IBM margin: ~20% on $75 wholesale = $15 Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Climb margin: ~25% on $60 wholesale = $15 Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ Per-txn: 0.05% + $0.01 Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöñ Γöé Tenant "PayFlow" Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Platform margin: $100/month Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Pass-through markup: $35 Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ Per-txn: 0.15% + $0.02 Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöñ Γöé Client "GymPayments" Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Their margin: $185/month Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ Per-txn: 2.70% + $0.27 Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÿ ``` --- ## toolFormerData.params:
{"plan":"# SaaS Composition Platform - Strategic Architecture Plan

## Executive Summary

This document outlines the architecture for a novel SaaS deployment platform that treats WebAssembly modules as composable "content" - analogous to how a CMS manages web content, but for executable business logic. The platform enables deep white-labeling across multiple tiers: Platform Provider -> Tenants -> Clients -> End Users.

The core technical innovation is porting Binaryen (WebAssembly optimizer) to build with Cosmopolitan Libc, producing a single universal binary that runs on Linux, macOS, Windows, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, and NetBSD without modification.

---

## Phase 1: Core Infrastructure

### 1.1 Binaryen Cosmopolitan Port

**Objective**: Produce a single `binaryen.com` binary containing wasm-opt, wasm-merge, wasm-ctor-eval, and related tools.

**Technical Approach**:

```
Binaryen C++ Source (WebAssembly/binaryen)
          Γöé
          Γû╝
ΓöîΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÉ
Γöé  Cosmopolitan Libc Build System     Γöé
Γöé  Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Replace libc calls             Γöé
Γöé  Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Adapt C++ runtime              Γöé

    Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Runs on 6+ operating systems
    Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ No dependencies
    ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ Self-contained toolchain
```

**Key Challenges**:
- Binaryen is ~500K lines of C++
- Heavy use of STL containers, exceptions, RTTI
- Filesystem and threading abstractions
- Cosmopolitan's C++ support is evolving

**Mitigation Strategy**:
- Start with Binaryen's C API surface only
- Incrementally port components
- Use Cosmopolitan's "actually portable executable" mode
- Leverage existing WASM-to-native work in Cosmopolitan

### 2.2 Licensing Model for IBM Modules

```
IBM PartnerWorld Structure:
Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Your Corporation: Authorized Reseller (embed license)
Γöé   Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Negotiate OEM/embedded pricing with IBM
Γöé   Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Volume commitments for better margins
Γöé   ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ Co-sell agreements for enterprise deals
Γöé
Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Module Pricing:
Γöé   Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ watson/assistant.wasm
Γöé   Γöé   Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ IBM wholesale: $X per MAU
Γöé   Γöé   Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Your margin: 20-30%
Γöé   Γöé   ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ Tenant pays: $X * 1.25 per MAU
Γöé   Γöé
Γöé   ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ watsonx/ai.wasm
Γöé       Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ IBM wholesale: $Y per 1M tokens
Γöé       Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Your margin: 15-25%
Γöé       ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ Usage metered, billed monthly
Γöé
ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ License Enforcement:
    Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Build-time: IBM modules only included if entitled
    Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Runtime: API calls authenticated with tenant keys
    ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ Metering: Usage reported to billing system
```

## Phase 3: Vertical Platform Modules

### 3.1 Platform Priority Order

Based on technical feasibility, market size, and differentiation:

| Priority | Vertical | Rationale |
|----------|----------|-----------|
| 1 | Observability/APM | Agent distribution showcases Cosmopolitan's universal binary value prop |
| 2 | Compliance/GRC | Binary-as-audit-artifact is unique, high regulatory value |
| 3 | Payment Processing | High value, complex, validates full composition pipeline |
| 4 | Headless Commerce | Broad market, many composition scenarios |
| 5 | Embedded Lending | Showcases watsonx.governance for model risk |
| 6 | Healthcare EHR | Deepest white-label, but most complex compliance |

### 3.2 Module Inventory Per Vertical

See detailed module listings in original architecture document (6 vertical platforms, each with Native/IBM/Climb module breakdowns).

Opus 4.5


benefit of rewriting binaryen to use with redbean




42 steps
Based on my research, here's what I found about combining Binaryen with redbean:

Context: The ludoplex/binaryen repository appears to be an exact mirror/fork of the upstream WebAssembly/binaryen project with no visible custom modifications for redbean integration. However, I can outline the potential benefits of rewriting/porting Binaryen to work with redbean and Cosmopolitan Libc:

Potential Benefits of Porting Binaryen for Redbean:

Universal Binary Distribution - Building Binaryen with Cosmopolitan Libc would produce a single executable that runs on Linux, macOS, Windows, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, and NetBSD without modification. This eliminates the need to distribute platform-specific binaries for wasm-opt and other Binaryen tools.
Embedded WebAssembly Optimization - Redbean is a single-file distributable web server. If Binaryen were embedded, redbean could perform on-the-fly WebAssembly optimization, minification, and transformations for wasm modules served by the server.
Self-Contained Toolchain - A Cosmopolitan-built Binaryen could be bundled inside a redbean .com file alongside Lua scripts and web assets, creating a fully self-contained wasm compilation/optimization pipeline that works anywhere.
Smaller Deployment Footprint - Cosmopolitan's "tiny" build mode can produce very small binaries. Combined with Binaryen's wasm optimization capabilities, this could enable compact deployment scenarios.
Sandboxed Execution - Redbean provides sandboxing and syscall tracing. Running Binaryen tools within this environment could add security when processing untrusted wasm files.
Challenges: Binaryen is a large C++ codebase with many dependencies, so porting it to Cosmopolitan would require adapting it to work with Cosmopolitan's libc implementation and build system.

Would you like me to search for any specific aspects of this integration, or look for any existing work on porting Binaryen to Cosmopolitan?



consider it a basis for CMS and more importantly, a natural analog to what CMS is for websites, this new application will be for SaaS



This is a fascinating architectural concept. Let me think through what you're describing:

The Analogy:

Traditional Web	Your Vision
CMS (WordPress, etc.)	Redbean + Binaryen
HTML/CSS/JS content	WebAssembly modules
Manages website content	Manages SaaS application logic
Theme/plugin system	Wasm module composition
Why Binaryen + Redbean Makes Sense for a "SaaS CMS":

Module Composition & Optimization - Binaryen's wasm-merge can bundle multiple wasm modules into one, connecting imports to exports. This is analogous to how a CMS assembles pages from components. You could dynamically compose SaaS features by merging wasm modules at deploy time or even runtime.
Hot-Swappable Business Logic - Just as a CMS lets you update content without redeploying, you could swap out wasm modules (billing logic, auth, feature flags) without rebuilding the entire application. Binaryen optimizes the result.
Multi-Tenant Isolation - Each tenant's custom logic could be a separate wasm module, sandboxed by design. Binaryen's optimization passes ensure these stay performant.
Universal Deployment - The Cosmopolitan/redbean foundation means your SaaS platform binary runs identically across all hosting environmentsΓÇöcloud VMs, edge nodes, on-prem servers, even customer infrastructure.
wasm-ctor-eval for Configuration - Binaryen can execute initialization code at compile time, "baking in" tenant-specific configuration without runtime overhead.
Size Optimization Pipeline - Binaryen's dead code elimination and minification become your "asset pipeline" for SaaS modules, similar to how a CMS optimizes images and bundles JS.
The Architecture Would Look Like:

Key Differentiators from Traditional SaaS:

Content = Code: Instead of managing text/media, you're managing executable business logic as composable wasm units
Build-time Customization: Tenant-specific builds via Binaryen optimization, not just runtime feature flags
Portable by Default: Single binary deploys anywhere without containerization complexity
Edge-Native: The small footprint enables true edge deployment of full SaaS functionality
What Would "Rewriting Binaryen" Entail:

You'd likely need to:

Port Binaryen to build with Cosmopolitan Libc
Expose Binaryen's C API to redbean's Lua environment
Create a module registry abstraction (like a CMS content database, but for wasm)
Build the composition/deployment orchestration layer
This is genuinely novelΓÇötreating wasm modules as the "content" of a SaaS platform the way HTML pages are the content of a website. Would you like to explore any specific aspect of this architecture further?

What Gets White-Labeled at Each Level:

Layer	You ΓåÆ Tenant	Tenant ΓåÆ Client
Branding	Logo, colors, domain	Sub-branding, custom domain
Features	Plan-based modules	Sub-plan restrictions
Pricing Logic	Tenant's margin built-in	Client tier pricing
API Endpoints	Tenant's namespace	Client's namespace
Data Isolation	Tenant boundary	Client boundary
Custom Logic	Tenant's wasm extensions	Client-specific workflows
The Binaryen Magic for White Labeling:

lua
-- Conceptual Lua orchestration in redbean

function build_tenant_binary(tenant_id)
  local tenant = get_tenant_config(tenant_id)
  
  -- Start with core modules
  local modules = {"core/auth.wasm", "core/billing.wasm", "core/api.wasm"}
  
  -- Add tenant's plan features
  for _, feature in ipairs(tenant.plan.features) do
    table.insert(modules, "features/" .. feature .. ".wasm")
  end
  
  -- Add tenant's custom modules
  for _, custom in ipairs(tenant.custom_modules) do
    table.insert(modules, "tenants/" .. tenant_id .. "/" .. custom)
  end
  
  -- Merge all modules
  local merged = binaryen.merge(modules)
  
  -- Bake in tenant branding/config at compile time
  merged = binaryen.ctor_eval(merged, {
    brand_name = tenant.brand.name,
    brand_colors = tenant.brand.colors,
    api_namespace = tenant.namespace,
    pricing_table = tenant.pricing,
  })
  
  -- Optimize and eliminate dead code
  merged = binaryen.optimize(merged, {
    level = "O3",
    shrink = true,
    eliminate_dead_code = true
  })
  
  return merged
end

function build_client_binary(tenant_id, client_id)
  -- Start with tenant's already-white-labeled build
  local base = get_tenant_binary(tenant_id)
  local client = get_client_config(tenant_id, client_id)
  
  -- Further customize for downstream client
  local customized = binaryen.ctor_eval(base, {
    client_brand = client.brand,
    client_features = client.tier.features,
    client_namespace = client.namespace,
  })
  
  -- Strip features not in client's tier
  customized = binaryen.optimize(customized, {
    eliminate_unused = client.tier.excluded_features
  })
  
  return customized
end
```

**Why This Beats Traditional White Labeling:**

| Traditional Approach | Binaryen + Redbean Approach |
|---------------------|----------------------------|
| Runtime feature flags | Compile-time elimination |
| Config files checked at runtime | Config baked into binary |
| All code shipped, gated by if-statements | Only purchased features exist in binary |
| Branding via CSS/theming | Branding compiled in, impossible to inspect |
| Multi-tenant = shared runtime | Each tenant gets isolated, optimized binary |
| "White label" = skin deep | White label = genuinely different artifact |

**The Killer Feature: True Isolation**

Each downstream client literally receives a **different binary**:

- They can't reverse-engineer features they didn't pay for (the code doesn't exist)
- They can't discover other tenants (no shared runtime)
- They can self-host if needed (it's just a portable binary)
- Performance is optimal (no runtime branching for features)

Γöé   Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ core.wasm
Γöé   ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ features/*.wasm
Γöé
ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ Tenant A downloads, runs:
    Γöé

--- name: SaaS Composition Platform Strategy overview: Strategic architecture document for a universal SaaS composition platform using Binaryen (dual native + WASM deployment) with Redbean/Cosmopolitan, enabling multi-tier white-label distribution through IBM and Climb Channel partnerships. todos: - id: binaryen-cosmo-assessment content: Assess Binaryen C++ codebase for Cosmopolitan Libc compatibility status: pending - id: binaryen-wasm-assessment content: Evaluate compiling Binaryen to WASM for self-hosting capability status: pending - id: ibm-partner-enrollment content: Initiate/confirm IBM PartnerWorld tier and access technical resources status: pending - id: climb-reseller-agreement content: Establish Climb Channel reseller agreement for priority vendors status: pending - id: legal-review content: Legal review of white-label licensing and compiled binary IP protection status: pending - id: redbean-lua-prototype content: Build minimal redbean + Lua + WASM composition proof-of-concept status: pending --- # SaaS Composition Platform - Strategic Architecture ## Executive Summary A "CMS for SaaS" platform that treats WebAssembly modules as composable content, enabling multi-tier white-labeling where each downstream tenant receives a unique, optimized binary with only their licensed features compiled in. The platform leverages authorized reseller relationships with IBM PartnerWorld and Climb Channel Solutions to embed enterprise capabilities.--- ## Core Technology Stack ### Dual Binaryen Architecture ```mermaid flowchart TB subgraph buildTime [Build-Time Layer] BinaryenCosmo[binaryen.com
Cosmopolitan Native] BuildPipeline[CI/CD Build Pipeline] ModuleRegistry[Module Registry] end subgraph runtime [Runtime Layer] Redbean[redbean.com
Universal Server] BinaryenWasm[binaryen.wasm
In-Process Optimizer] LuaOrch[Lua Orchestration] SQLite[SQLite State] end subgraph outputs [Deployment Artifacts] TenantBinary[Tenant Binary
White-Labeled] ClientBinary[Client Binary
Sub-Labeled] AgentBinary[Agent Binary
Lightweight] end ModuleRegistry --> BinaryenCosmo BinaryenCosmo --> BuildPipeline BuildPipeline --> TenantBinary TenantBinary --> Redbean BinaryenWasm --> LuaOrch LuaOrch --> ClientBinary LuaOrch --> AgentBinary ``` **Native Binaryen (Cosmopolitan Build)** - Single `binaryen.com` binary runs on Linux, macOS, Windows, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, NetBSD - Full optimization suite: `wasm-merge`, `wasm-opt`, `wasm-ctor-eval`, `wasm-metadce` - Build pipeline use: tenant binary generation, CI/CD integration - Performance target: native speed for heavy optimization passes **WASM Binaryen (Self-Hosted)** - `binaryen.wasm` runs inside redbean's WASM runtime - Enables runtime module composition without external tooling - Tenant-safe: sandboxed execution, no filesystem access - Powers: hot module swapping, dynamic feature activation, client-side preview --- ## Platform Architecture ### Module Registry Structure ```javascript /registry/ Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ native/ # Your proprietary IP Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ core/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ auth.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ billing.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ api-gateway.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ data-layer.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ verticals/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ payments/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ healthcare/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ lending/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ observability/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ grc/ Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ commerce/ Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ frameworks/ # GRC frameworks Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ soc2-type2.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ hipaa.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ ... Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ ibm/ # IBM resold modules Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ watson/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ assistant.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ discovery.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ nlp.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ watsonx/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ ai.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ governance.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ data.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ security/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ verify.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ guardium.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ qradar.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ sterling/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ oms.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ fulfillment.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ inventory.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ climb/ # Climb Channel resold Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ thales/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ sailpoint/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ snowflake/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ hashicorp/ Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ ... Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ tenants/{tenant-id}/ # Tenant custom modules ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ custom/ ``` ### Composition Engine ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Admin as Tenant Admin participant Portal as Build Portal participant Registry as Module Registry participant Binaryen as Binaryen Engine participant Artifact as Artifact Store Admin->>Portal: Configure build (features, branding, config) Portal->>Registry: Resolve module dependencies Registry-->>Portal: Module list + entitlements Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-merge (combine modules) Binaryen-->>Portal: Merged module Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-ctor-eval (bake config) Note right of Binaryen: Brand, API keys, pricing
compiled into binary Binaryen-->>Portal: Configured module Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-opt -O3 (optimize + DCE) Note right of Binaryen: Dead code elimination
removes unlicensed features Binaryen-->>Portal: Optimized module Portal->>Portal: Package into redbean .com Portal->>Artifact: Store versioned binary Portal-->>Admin: Download link + manifest ``` ### Entitlement Model | Enforcement Type | Mechanism | Use Case | |-----------------|-----------|----------| | **Compile-Time** | Module not included in build | Feature tiers, unlicensed capabilities | | **Bake-Time** | `wasm-ctor-eval` embeds values | Branding, API keys, rate limits | | **Link-Time** | Dead code elimination removes paths | Unused integrations, regional features | | **Run-Time** | License server check | Seat counts, metered usage, expiration |--- ## IBM Integration Strategy (Aligned to Tiering) ### S Tier: AI + Security (Build First, Together) These are **foundational capabilities** that enable all S-tier verticals. | IBM Product | WASM Module | Tier | Enables | |-------------|-------------|------|---------| | Watson Assistant | `ibm/watson/assistant.wasm` | S-AI | Healthcare intake, lending support, payment help | | Watson Discovery | `ibm/watson/discovery.wasm` | S-AI | Clinical search, document intelligence | | Watson NLP | `ibm/watson/nlp.wasm` | S-AI | Entity extraction across all verticals | | watsonx.ai | `ibm/watsonx/ai.wasm` | S-AI | LLM inference, underwriting models | | watsonx.governance | `ibm/watsonx/governance.wasm` | S-AI | Model risk management (lending requirement) | | Verify | `ibm/security/verify.wasm` | S-Security | Auth for all verticals, 3DS for payments | | Guardium | `ibm/security/guardium.wasm` | S-Security | PHI monitoring (healthcare), PCI audit (payments) | | QRadar | `ibm/security/qradar.wasm` | S-Security | Threat detection, compliance evidence | | Trusteer | `ibm/security/trusteer.wasm` | S-Security | Fraud prevention (payments, lending) | **Licensing Model**: IBM Cloud Pak consumption-based, OEM embedding terms for compiled modules. ### A Tier: Observability + Commerce Enablers (Build Second) | IBM Product | WASM Module | Tier | Enables | |-------------|-------------|------|---------| | Instana | `ibm/observability/instana.wasm` | A-Observability | Full APM capabilities | | Turbonomic | `ibm/observability/turbonomic.wasm` | A-Observability | Resource optimization | | watsonx AIOps | `ibm/observability/aiops.wasm` | A-Observability | Incident correlation | | Sterling OMS | `ibm/sterling/oms.wasm` | A-Commerce | Complex order orchestration | | API Connect | `ibm/integration/apiconnect.wasm` | A-Commerce | API management | ### B Tier: Supply Chain + Process (Build Later) | IBM Product | WASM Module | Tier | Enables | |-------------|-------------|------|---------| | Sterling Fulfillment | `ibm/sterling/fulfillment.wasm` | B-SupplyChain | Fulfillment optimization | | Sterling Inventory | `ibm/sterling/inventory.wasm` | B-SupplyChain | Real-time ATP | | Cloud Pak Automation | `ibm/automation/cpba.wasm` | B-DevOps | Workflow, decisions | | Process Mining | `ibm/automation/processmining.wasm` | B-GRC | Control effectiveness | --- ## Climb Channel Integration Strategy (Aligned to Tiering) ### S Tier Vendors (Build First) | Category | Vendor | Products | Enables | |----------|--------|----------|---------| | **Security** | Thales | SafeNet HSM, CipherTrust | PCI tokenization (payments), encryption | | **Security** | CyberArk | Privileged Access | PAM for high-security tenants | | **Security** | Entrust | PKI, certificates | Document signing (healthcare, lending) | | **Fraud** | Alloy | Fraud orchestration | Lending application fraud | | **KYC** | Onfido/Socure | Identity verification | Merchant/borrower onboarding | | **Banking** | Plaid | Bank verification | ACH (payments), income (lending) | | **Credit** | Experian/Equifax/TU | Credit bureaus | Lending underwriting | | **Data** | Informatica | MDM | Patient matching (healthcare) | | **Privacy** | BigID | Data discovery | PHI/PII classification | ### A Tier Vendors (Build Second) | Category | Vendor | Products | Enables | |----------|--------|----------|---------| | **Identity** | SailPoint | IdentityNow | Access governance | | **Identity** | Ping Identity | PingOne, ```mermaid flowchart LR subgraph sTier [S Tier - Build First] AI[AI / Watson / watsonx] Payments[Payment Processing] Lending[Embedded Lending] Healthcare[Healthcare EHR] Security[Security] end subgraph aTier [A Tier - Build Second] Commerce[Headless Commerce] Observability[Observability / APM] Identity[Identity] end subgraph bTier [B Tier - Build Later] GRC[Compliance / GRC] Search[Search] Data[Data] DevOps[DevOps] SupplyChain[Supply Chain] end sTier --> aTier aTier --> bTier ``` --- ## S Tier: Verticals and Capabilities (Build First) ### AI (Watson / watsonx) - Foundational Capability | Component | IBM Product | Module | Integration | |-----------|-------------|--------|-------------| | Conversational | Watson Assistant | `ibm/watson/assistant.wasm` | Embedded in all customer-facing verticals | | Search/NLU | Watson Discovery | `ibm/watson/discovery.wasm` | Clinical search, document intelligence | | Language | Watson NLP | `ibm/watson/nlp.wasm` | Entity extraction, sentiment, classification | | Foundation Models | watsonx.ai | `ibm/watsonx/ai.wasm` | LLM inference, prompt engineering | | AI Governance | watsonx.governance | `ibm/watsonx/governance.wasm` | Model lineage, bias detection, MRM | | Data Platform | watsonx.data | `ibm/watsonx/data.wasm` | Lakehouse, Presto/Spark analytics | **Strategic Value**: AI modules are horizontal enablers across all verticals. Build once, compose everywhere. ### Payment Processing - **Core Modules**: Ledger, reconciliation, settlement, card processing, ACH, wire, real-time payments - **IBM Integration**: Trusteer (fraud), Verify (3DS/SCA), ODM (pricing rules, fraud rules) - **Climb Integration**: Thales HSM (PCI tokenization), Plaid (bank verification) - **Differentiator**: Fee structures compiled in, per-merchant optimized binaries, audit-proof pricing logic ### Embedded Lending / BNPL - **Core Modules**: Application intake, underwriting engine, origination, servicing, collections - **IBM Integration**: ODM (credit decisioning), watsonx.ai (ML underwriting), watsonx.governance (model risk management) - **Climb Integration**: Credit bureaus (Experian/Equifax/TransUnion), Plaid (income), Alloy (fraud orchestration) - **Differentiator**: Underwriting logic is compiled IP (cannot be reverse-engineered), fair lending provable via build manifest ### Healthcare EHR - **Core Modules**: Patient demographics, scheduling, clinical notes, orders, claims, billing - **IBM Integration**: Watson Discovery (clinical search), Watson NLP (clinical extraction), Guardium (PHI monitoring) - **Climb Integration**: Informatica MDM (patient matching), BigID (PHI discovery), DocuSign (consent) - **Differentiator**: HIPAA compliance baked into binary, specialty-specific builds (dental, veterinary, behavioral health) ### Security - Foundational Capability | Component | IBM Product | Module | Integration | |-----------|-------------|--------|-------------| | Identity/Auth | Verify | `ibm/security/verify.wasm` | OIDC/SAML, MFA, adaptive auth, passwordless | | Data Protection | Guardium | `ibm/security/guardium.wasm` | Data activity monitoring, audit trails | | SIEM | QRadar | `ibm/security/qradar.wasm` | Threat detection, security analytics | | Fraud | Trusteer | `ibm/security/trusteer.wasm` | Device fingerprinting, session protection | | Component | Climb Vendor | Module | Integration | |-----------|--------------|--------|-------------| | HSM/Encryption | Thales | `climb/thales/hsm.wasm` | Hardware security, tokenization | | PAM | CyberArk | `climb/cyberark/pam.wasm` | Privileged access management | | PKI | Entrust | `climb/entrust/pki.wasm` | Certificates, document signing | **Strategic Value**: Security modules are mandatory for regulated verticals (payments, lending, healthcare). Build robust, reuse everywhere. --- ## A Tier: Verticals and Capabilities (Build Second) ### Headless Commerce - **Core Modules**: Catalog, cart, checkout, orders, pricing (simple/volume/contract/subscription), inventory - **IBM Integration**: Sterling OMS (complex orders), Watson Assistant (shopping assistant), Watson Discovery (product search) - **Climb Integration**: Algolia (search), Stripe/Adyen (payments), Avalara (tax), Shippo (shipping) - **Differentiator**: B2B vs B2C vs subscription builds with dead code elimination, vertical-specific checkout flows ### Observability / APM - **Core Modules**: Collectors (OTLP, Prometheus, StatsD), processors, storage, query, alerting, dashboards - **IBM Integration**: Instana (full APM), Turbonomic (resource optimization), watsonx AIOps (correlation) - **Climb Integration**: Elastic (logs), Confluent Kafka (streaming), PagerDuty (incidents) - **Differentiator**: Single-file universal agent, protocol-specific builds, environment-specific (K8s, edge, VM) ### Identity - Horizontal Capability | Component | IBM Product | Module | Integration | |-----------|-------------|--------|-------------| | IAM | Verify | `ibm/security/verify.wasm` | (shared with Security tier) | | Component | Climb Vendor | Module | Integration | |-----------|--------------|--------|-------------| | IGA | SailPoint | `climb/sailpoint/identitynow.wasm` | Access governance, provisioning, certifications | | Federation | Ping Identity | `climb/ping/pingone.wasm` | Alternative IAM, workforce identity | **Strategic Value**: Identity bridges security (S-tier) and enables multi-tenant access patterns across all verticals. --- ## B Tier: Capabilities (Build Later) ### Compliance / GRC - **Core Modules**: Control framework, risk register, policy management, evidence collection, reporting - **Frameworks**: SOC2, ISO27001, PCI-DSS, HIPAA, GDPR, NIST, FedRAMP, SOX - **IBM Integration**: QRadar (SIEM evidence), Guardium (DAM evidence), Process Mining (control effectiveness) - **Climb Integration**: OneTrust (privacy), BigID (data discovery), Qualys/Tenable (vulnerability) - **Note**: Many GRC capabilities are embedded in S-tier verticals (healthcare HIPAA, payments PCI) ### Search - **Climb Integration**: Elastic (Elasticsearch), Algolia (hosted search) - **IBM Integration**: Watson Discovery (semantic search) - **Note**: Search is consumed by S/A tier verticals, not standalone ### Data - **Climb Integration**: Snowflake (warehouse), Databricks (lakehouse), Informatica (integration/MDM) - **IBM Integration**: watsonx.data (lakehouse) - **Note**: Data infrastructure supports analytics across verticals ### DevOps - **Climb Integration**: HashiCorp (Vault, Terraform, Consul), GitLab (CI/CD), JFrog (Artifactory) - **Note**: DevOps tooling is internal infrastructure, not customer-facing modules ### Supply Chain - **IBM Integration**: Sterling OMS, Sterling Fulfillment, Sterling Inventory - **Note**: Supply chain capabilities are consumed by Commerce (A-tier), not standalone vertical --- ## Implementation Phases (Aligned to S/A/B Tiering) ```mermaid gantt title Implementation Roadmap dateFormat YYYY-MM section Foundation Binaryen Cosmo Port :p0a, 2026-01, 3M Binaryen WASM Build :p0b, 2026-02, 2M Composition Engine MVP :p1, after p0a, 3M Tenant Management :p2, after p1, 2M section S Tier IBM AI + Security :s1, after p1, 4M Climb S-Tier Vendors :s2, after p1, 3M Payments Vertical :s3, after s1, 4M Lending Vertical :s4, after s3, 3M Healthcare Vertical :s5, after s4, 4M section A Tier Commerce Vertical :a1, after s5, 3M Observability Vertical :a2, after a1, 3M Identity Expansion :a3, after a2, 2M section B Tier GRC Capabilities :b1, after a3, 3M Data + DevOps :b2, after b1, 2M ``` ### Phase 0: Foundation (Months 1-5) **0.1 Binaryen Cosmopolitan Port** - Port Binaryen C++ codebase to build with Cosmopolitan Libc - Produce `binaryen.com` universal binary (runs on 6 OS targets) - Validate core tools: wasm-merge, wasm-opt, wasm-ctor-eval, wasm-metadce - Test performance parity with native builds **0.2 Binaryen WASM Self-Hosting** - Compile Binaryen to WASM using Emscripten or native wasm target - Integrate binaryen.wasm into redbean's WASM runtime - Enable runtime module composition without external processes - Validate sandboxed execution for tenant safety **0.3 Composition Engine MVP** - Lua orchestration layer in redbean - Module registry (filesystem-based, later JFrog Artifactory) - Build pipeline: resolve dependencies, merge, configure, optimize, package - CLI interface for builds - Simple web portal for configuration **0.4 Tenant Management** - Multi-tenant state in SQLite - Entitlement engine (compile-time module selection, bake-time config, runtime license checks) - Build artifact versioning and rollback - Tenant self-service portal - Build manifests and audit trails ### Phase 1: S Tier - AI + Security Foundation (Months 4-8) **1.1 IBM AI Integration** - Watson Assistant wrapper module (conversational AI) - Watson Discovery wrapper module (document search/NLU) - Watson NLP wrapper module (entity extraction, sentiment) - watsonx.ai integration (LLM inference endpoints) - watsonx.governance integration (model lineage, bias detection) - IBM Cloud Pak licensing integration and metering **1.2 IBM Security Integration** - Verify wrapper module (OIDC/SAML, MFA, adaptive auth) - Guardium wrapper module (data activity monitoring) - QRadar wrapper module (SIEM, threat detection) - Trusteer wrapper module (fraud, device fingerprinting) **1.3 Climb S-Tier Vendors** - Thales HSM integration (tokenization, encryption) - Plaid integration (bank verification, income) - Credit bureau integrations (Experian, Equifax, TransUnion) - Alloy/Socure integration (fraud orchestration, KYC) - BigID integration (PHI/PII discovery) - Informatica MDM integration (patient matching) ### Phase 2: S Tier - Verticals (Months 8-19) **2.1 Payment Processing Vertical** - Core modules: ledger, reconciliation, settlement, card processing - Integration: Trusteer fraud, Verify 3DS, Thales tokenization - Build configurations: ISO/PayFac, merchant, POS - Pilot: 1-2 payment platform tenants - White-label validation: 3-tier depth (platform > tenant > client > merchant) **2.2 Embedded Lending Vertical** - Core modules: application, underwriting, origination, servicing, collections - Integration: ODM decisioning, watsonx.ai ML models, watsonx.governance MRM - Integration: credit bureaus, Plaid income, Alloy fraud - Build configurations: consumer, SMB, merchant cash advance, BNPL - Pilot: 1-2 lending platform tenants **2.3 Healthcare EHR Vertical** - Core modules: demographics, scheduling, clinical notes, billing, claims - Integration: Watson Discovery clinical search, Watson NLP extraction, Guardium PHI - Integration: Informatica MDM, BigID PHI discovery - Build configurations: dental, veterinary, behavioral health, primary care - Pilot: 1-2 healthcare platform tenants - HIPAA compliance validation: binary-as-audit-artifact ### Phase 3: A Tier - Commerce, Observability, Identity (Months 19-27) **3.1 Headless Commerce Vertical** - Core modules: catalog, cart, checkout, orders, pricing, inventory - Integration: Sterling OMS, Watson search, Algolia, payments, tax - Build configurations: B2B wholesale, B2C DTC, subscription, marketplace - Pilot tenants **3.2 Observability/APM Vertical** - Core modules: collectors, processors, storage, alerting, dashboards - Integration: Instana, Turbonomic, Elastic, Kafka, PagerDuty - Build configurations: K8s, edge/IoT, VM, hybrid - Universal agent: single binary for all platforms - Pilot tenants **3.3 Identity Expansion** - SailPoint IdentityNow integration (governance, provisioning) - Ping Identity integration (alternative IAM) - Cross-vertical identity federation - B2B partner access patterns ### Phase 4: B Tier - Supporting Capabilities (Months 27-32) **4.1 Compliance/GRC** - Framework modules: SOC2, ISO27001, PCI-DSS, HIPAA, GDPR, NIST - Integration: OneTrust, Qualys/Tenable - Note: Much GRC capability already embedded in S-tier verticals **4.2 Data + DevOps Infrastructure** - Snowflake/Databricks analytics integration - HashiCorp Vault secrets management - JFrog Artifactory for module registry - GitLab CI/CD for build automation ### Phase 5: Scale (Months 32+) - Additional vertical specializations - Geographic expansion (EU data residency builds) - Marketplace for third-party modules - Enterprise features (SSO, advanced audit, custom compliance frameworks) - Partner ecosystem development --- ## Technical Risks and Mitigations | Risk | Impact | Mitigation | |------|--------|------------| | Binaryen Cosmopolitan port complexity | High | Start with C API subset, expand incrementally | | WASM-in-WASM performance | Medium | Use native for heavy ops, WASM for flexibility | | IBM licensing complexity | Medium | Engage IBM partner manager early, clarify OEM terms | | Module size bloat | Medium | Aggressive DCE, modular architecture | | Tenant isolation in shared builds | High | Compile-time separation, no runtime multi-tenancy |--- ## Success Metrics (By Phase) | Metric | Phase 0 (Foundation) | Phase 2 (S-Tier Verticals) | Phase 3 (A-Tier) | Phase 5 (Scale) | |--------|---------------------|---------------------------|------------------|-----------------| | Binary size (base) | < 10MB | < 15MB | < 20MB | < 25MB | | Build time (full) | < 30s | < 60s | < 90s | < 120s | | OS targets | 6 | 6 | 6 | 6 | | Module registry | 20 native | 80+ (native + IBM + Climb) | 150+ | 300+ | | IBM modules | 0 | 10 (AI + Security) | 15 | 20+ | | Climb integrations | 0 | 10 (S-tier vendors) | 20 | 40+ | | Active tenants | 0 (internal) | 3-6 pilots (payments, lending, healthcare) | 15+ | 50+ | | White-label depth | 2 tiers | 3 tiers validated | 4 tiers | Unlimited | | Revenue (ARR) | $0 | $500K (pilots) | $2M | $10M+ | ### Key Milestones | Milestone | Target Date | Success Criteria | |-----------|-------------|------------------| | Binaryen universal binary | Month 3 | wasm-opt runs on 6 OS targets from single binary | | Binaryen self-hosting | Month 4 | binaryen.wasm composes modules inside redbean | | First S-tier vertical pilot | Month 12 | Payment platform tenant live with white-label client | | Three S-tier verticals live | Month 19 | Payments, lending, healthcare all with pilot tenants | | IBM revenue recognition | Month 15 | First IBM resale margin realized | | Climb revenue recognition | Month 12 | First Climb resale margin realized | --- ## Next Steps (Immediate) ### Technical 1. **Binaryen Port Assessment**: Evaluate Binaryen C++ codebase for Cosmopolitan Libc compatibility 2. **Binaryen WASM Assessment**: Evaluate Emscripten vs native WASM target for self-hosting build 3. **Redbean Prototype**: Minimal Lua + WASM composition proof-of-concept ### Business 4. **IBM PartnerWorld**: Initiate/confirm partner tier, access technical resources, clarify OEM embedding terms 5. **Climb Channel Agreement**: Establish reseller agreement for S-tier vendors (Thales, Plaid, credit bureaus) 6. **Legal Review**: White-label licensing terms, compiled binary IP protection, multi-tier sublicensing ### Market Validation 7. **Vertical Discovery**: Identify 2-3 potential pilot tenants for payment processing vertical 8. **Pricing Model**: Develop platform fee + margin structure for multi-tier white-labeling

Strategic Architecture ## Executive Summary A "CMS for SaaS" platform that treats WebAssembly modules as composable content, enabling multi-tier white-labeling where each downstream tenant receives a unique, optimized binary with only their licensed features compiled in. The platform leverages authorized reseller relationships with IBM PartnerWorld and Climb Channel Solutions to embed enterprise capabilities.--- ## Core Technology Stack ### Dual Binaryen Architecture ```mermaid flowchart TB subgraph buildTime [Build-Time Layer] BinaryenCosmo[binaryen.com
Cosmopolitan Native] BuildPipeline[CI/CD Build Pipeline] ModuleRegistry[Module Registry] end subgraph runtime [Runtime Layer] Redbean[redbean.com
Universal Server] BinaryenWasm[binaryen.wasm
In-Process Optimizer] LuaOrch[Lua Orchestration] SQLite[SQLite State] end subgraph outputs [Deployment Artifacts] TenantBinary[Tenant Binary
White-Labeled] ClientBinary[Client Binary
Sub-Labeled] AgentBinary[Agent Binary
Lightweight] end ModuleRegistry --> BinaryenCosmo BinaryenCosmo --> BuildPipeline BuildPipeline --> TenantBinary TenantBinary --> Redbean BinaryenWasm --> LuaOrch LuaOrch --> ClientBinary LuaOrch --> AgentBinary ``` **Native Binaryen (Cosmopolitan Build)** - Single `binaryen.com` binary runs on Linux, macOS, Windows, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, NetBSD - Full optimization suite: `wasm-merge`, `wasm-opt`, `wasm-ctor-eval`, `wasm-metadce` - Build pipeline use: tenant binary generation, CI/CD integration - Performance target: native speed for heavy optimization passes **WASM Binaryen (Self-Hosted)** - `binaryen.wasm` runs inside redbean's WASM runtime - Enables runtime module composition without external tooling - Tenant-safe: sandboxed execution, no filesystem access - Powers: hot module swapping, dynamic feature activation, client-side preview --- ## Platform Architecture ### Module Registry Structure ```javascript /registry/ Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ native/ # Your proprietary IP Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ core/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ auth.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ billing.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ api-gateway.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ data-layer.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ verticals/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ payments/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ healthcare/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ lending/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ observability/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ grc/ Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ commerce/ Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ frameworks/ # GRC frameworks Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ soc2-type2.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ hipaa.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ ... Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ ibm/ # IBM resold modules Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ watson/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ assistant.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ discovery.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ nlp.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ watsonx/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ ai.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ governance.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ data.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ security/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ verify.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ guardium.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ qradar.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ sterling/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ oms.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ fulfillment.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ inventory.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ climb/ # Climb Channel resold Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ thales/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ sailpoint/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ snowflake/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ hashicorp/ Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ ... Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ tenants/{tenant-id}/ # Tenant custom modules ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ custom/ ``` ### Composition Engine ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Admin as Tenant Admin participant Portal as Build Portal participant Registry as Module Registry participant Binaryen as Binaryen Engine participant Artifact as Artifact Store Admin->>Portal: Configure build (features, branding, config) Portal->>Registry: Resolve module dependencies Registry-->>Portal: Module list + entitlements Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-merge (combine modules) Binaryen-->>Portal: Merged module Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-ctor-eval (bake config) Note right of Binaryen: Brand, API keys, pricing
compiled into binary Binaryen-->>Portal: Configured module Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-opt -O3 (optimize + DCE) Note right of Binaryen: Dead code elimination
removes unlicensed features Binaryen-->>Portal: Optimized module Portal->>Portal: Package into redbean .com Portal->>Artifact: Store versioned binary Portal-->>Admin: Download link + manifest ``` ### Entitlement Model | Enforcement Type | Mechanism | Use Case | |-----------------|-----------|----------| | **Compile-Time** | Module not included in build | Feature tiers, unlicensed capabilities | | **Bake-Time** | `wasm-ctor-eval` embeds values | Branding, API keys, rate limits | | **Link-Time** | Dead code elimination removes paths | Unused integrations, regional features | | **Run-Time** | License server check | Seat counts, metered usage, expiration |--- ## IBM Integration Strategy (Aligned to Tiering) ### S Tier: AI + Security (Build First, Together) These are **foundational | Component | IBM Product | Module | Integration | |-----------|-------------|--------|-------------| | Conversational | Watson Assistant | `ibm/watson/assistant.wasm` | Embedded in all customer-facing verticals | | Search/NLU | Watson Discovery | `ibm/watson/discovery.wasm` | Clinical search, document intelligence | | Language | Watson NLP | `ibm/watson/nlp.wasm` | Entity `ibm/watsonx/governance.wasm` | Model lineage, bias detection, MRM | | Data Platform | watsonx.data | `ibm/watsonx/data.wasm` | Lakehouse, Presto/Spark analytics | **Strategic Value**: AI modules are horizontal enablers across all verticals. Build once, compose everywhere. ### Payment Processing - **Core Modules**: Ledger, reconciliation, settlement, card processing, ACH, wire, real-time payments - **IBM Integration**: Trusteer (fraud), Verify (3DS/SCA), ODM (pricing rules, fraud rules) - **Climb Integration**: Thales HSM (PCI tokenization), Plaid (bank verification) - **Differentiator**: Fee structures compiled in, per-merchant optimized binaries, audit-proof pricing logic ### Embedded Lending / BNPL - **Core Modules**: Application intake, underwriting engine, origination, servicing, collections - **IBM Integration**: ODM (credit decisioning), watsonx.ai (ML underwriting), watsonx.governance (model risk management) - **Climb Integration**: Credit bureaus (Experian/Equifax/TransUnion), Plaid (income), Alloy (fraud orchestration) - **Differentiator**: Underwriting logic is compiled IP (cannot be reverse-engineered), fair lending provable via build manifest ### Healthcare EHR - **Core Modules**: Patient demographics, scheduling, clinical notes, orders, claims, billing - **IBM Integration**: Watson Discovery (clinical search), Watson NLP (clinical extraction), Guardium (PHI monitoring) - **Climb Integration**: Informatica MDM (patient matching), BigID (PHI discovery), DocuSign (consent) - **Differentiator**: HIPAA compliance baked into binary, specialty-specific builds (dental, veterinary, behavioral health) ### Security - Foundational Capability | Component | IBM Product | Module | Integration | |-----------|-------------|--------|-------------| | Identity/Auth | Verify | `ibm/security/verify.wasm` | OIDC/SAML, MFA, adaptive auth, passwordless | | Data Protection | Guardium | `ibm/security/guardium.wasm` | Data activity monitoring, audit trails | | SIEM | QRadar | `ibm/security/qradar.wasm` | Threat detection, security analytics | | Fraud | Trusteer | `ibm/security/trusteer.wasm` | Device fingerprinting, session protection | | Component | Climb Vendor | Module | Integration | |-----------|--------------|--------|-------------| | HSM/Encryption | Thales | `climb/thales/hsm.wasm` | Hardware security, tokenization | | PAM | CyberArk | `climb/cyberark/pam.wasm` | Privileged access management | | PKI | Entrust | `climb/entrust/pki.wasm` | Certificates, document signing | **Strategic Value**: Security modules are mandatory for regulated verticals (payments, lending, healthcare). performance parity with native builds **0.2 Binaryen WASM Self-Hosting** - Compile Binaryen to WASM using Emscripten or native wasm target - Integrate binaryen.wasm into redbean's WASM runtime - (tokenization, encryption) - Plaid integration (bank verification, income) - Credit bureau integrations (Experian, Equifax, TransUnion) - Alloy/Socure integration (fraud orchestration, KYC) - BigID integration (PHI/PII discovery) - Informatica MDM integration (patient matching) ### Phase 2: S Tier - Verticals (Months 8-19) **2.1 Payment Processing Vertical** - Core modules: ledger, reconciliation, settlement, card processing - Integration: Trusteer fraud, Verify 3DS, Thales tokenization - Build configurations: ISO/PayFac, merchant, POS - Pilot: 1-2 payment platform tenants - White-label validation: 3-tier depth (platform > tenant > client > merchant) **2.2 Embedded Lending Vertical** - Core modules: application, underwriting, origination, servicing, collections - Integration: ODM decisioning, watsonx.ai ML models, watsonx.governance MRM - Integration: credit bureaus, Plaid income, Alloy fraud - Build configurations: consumer, SMB, merchant cash advance, BNPL - Pilot: 1-2 lending platform tenants **2.3 Healthcare EHR Vertical** - Core modules: demographics, scheduling, clinical notes, billing, claims - Integration: Watson Discovery clinical search, Watson NLP extraction, Guardium PHI - Integration: Informatica MDM, BigID PHI discovery - Build configurations: dental, veterinary, behavioral health, primary care - Pilot: 1-2 healthcare platform tenants - HIPAA compliance validation: binary-as-audit-artifact ### Phase 3: A Tier - Commerce, Observability, Identity (Months 19-27) **3.1 Headless Commerce Vertical** - Core modules: catalog, cart, checkout, orders, pricing, inventory - Integration: Sterling OMS, Watson search, Algolia, payments, tax - Build configurations: B2B wholesale, B2C DTC, subscription, marketplace - Pilot tenants **3.2 Observability/APM Vertical** - Core modules: collectors, processors, storage, alerting, dashboards - Integration: Instana, Turbonomic, Elastic, Kafka, PagerDuty - Build configurations: K8s, edge/IoT, VM, hybrid - Universal agent: single binary for all platforms - Pilot tenants **3.3 Identity Expansion** - SailPoint IdentityNow integration (governance, provisioning) - Ping Identity integration (alternative IAM) - Cross-vertical identity federation - B2B partner access patterns ### Phase 4: B Tier - Supporting Capabilities (Months 27-32) **4.1 Compliance/GRC** - Framework modules: SOC2, ISO27001, PCI-DSS, HIPAA, GDPR, NIST - Integration: OneTrust, Qualys/Tenable - Note: Much GRC capability already embedded in S-tier verticals **4.2 Data + DevOps Infrastructure** - Snowflake/Databricks analytics integration - HashiCorp Vault secrets management - JFrog Artifactory for module registry - GitLab CI/CD for build automation ### Phase 5: Scale (Months 32+) - Additional vertical specializations - Geographic expansion (EU data residency builds) - Marketplace for third-party modules - Enterprise features (SSO, advanced audit, custom compliance frameworks) - Partner ecosystem development --- ## Technical Risks and Mitigations | Risk | Impact | Mitigation | |------|--------|------------| | Binaryen Cosmopolitan port complexity | High | Start with C API subset, expand incrementally | | WASM-in-WASM performance | Medium | Use native for heavy ops, WASM for flexibility | | IBM licensing complexity | Medium | Engage IBM partner manager early, clarify OEM terms | | Module size bloat | Medium | Aggressive DCE, modular architecture | | Tenant isolation in shared builds | High | Compile-time separation, no runtime multi-tenancy |--- ## Success Metrics (By Phase) | Metric | Phase 0 (Foundation) | Phase 2 (S-Tier Verticals) | Phase 3 (A-Tier) | Phase 5 (Scale) | |--------|---------------------|---------------------------|------------------|-----------------| | Binary size (base) | < 10MB | < 15MB | < 20MB | < 25MB | | Build time (full) | < 30s | < 60s | < 90s | < 120s | | OS targets | 6 | 6 | 6 | 6 | | Module registry | 20 native | 80+ (native + IBM + Climb) | 150+ | 300+ | | IBM modules | 0 | 10 (AI + Security) | 15 | 20+ | | Climb integrations | 0 | 10 (S-tier vendors) | 20 | 40+ | | Active tenants | 0 (internal) | 3-6 pilots (payments, lending, healthcare) | 15+ | 50+ | | White-label depth | 2 tiers | 3 tiers validated | 4 tiers | Unlimited | | Revenue (ARR) | $0 | $500K (pilots) | $2M | $10M+ | ### Key Milestones | Milestone | Target Date | Success Criteria | |-----------|-------------|------------------| | Binaryen universal binary | Month 3 | wasm-opt runs on 6 OS targets from single binary | | Binaryen self-hosting | Month 4 | binaryen.wasm composes modules inside redbean | | First S-tier vertical pilot | Month 12 | Payment platform tenant live with white-label client | | Three S-tier verticals live | Month 19 | Payments, lending, healthcare all with pilot tenants | | IBM revenue recognition | Month 15 | First IBM resale margin realized | | Climb revenue recognition | Month 12 | First Climb resale margin realized | --- ## Next Steps (Immediate) ### Technical 1. **Binaryen Port Assessment**: Evaluate Binaryen C++ codebase for Cosmopolitan Libc compatibility 2. **Binaryen WASM Assessment**: Evaluate Emscripten vs native WASM target for self-hosting build 3. **Redbean Prototype**: Minimal Lua + WASM composition proof-of-concept ### Business 4. **IBM PartnerWorld**: Initiate/confirm partner tier, access technical resources, clarify OEM embedding terms 5. **Climb Channel Agreement**: Establish reseller agreement for S-tier vendors (Thales, Plaid, credit bureaus) 6. **Legal Review**: White-label licensing terms, compiled binary IP protection, multi-tier sublicensing ### Market Validation 7. **Vertical Discovery**: Identify 2-3 potential pilot tenants for payment processing vertical 8. **Pricing Model**: Develop platform fee + margin structure for multi-tier white-labeling"}
