--- name: SaaS Composition Platform Strategy overview: Strategic architecture document for a universal SaaS composition platform using Binaryen (dual native + WASM deployment) with Redbean/Cosmopolitan, enabling multi-tier white-label distribution through IBM and Climb Channel partnerships. Tiered approach with S-tier (AI, Payments, Lending, Healthcare, Security) built first. todos: - id: binaryen-cosmo-port content: "Phase 0: Port Binaryen C++ to Cosmopolitan Libc, produce universal binary" status: pending - id: binaryen-wasm-build content: "Phase 0: Compile Binaryen to WASM for self-hosting in redbean runtime" status: pending - id: composition-engine-mvp content: "Phase 0: Build Lua orchestration + module registry + build pipeline in redbean" status: pending - id: ibm-partner-enrollment content: "Business: Initiate IBM PartnerWorld tier, clarify OEM embedding terms for AI + Security" status: pending - id: climb-s-tier-agreement content: "Business: Establish Climb reseller for S-tier vendors (Thales, Plaid, bureaus, BigID)" status: pending - id: legal-whitelabel-review content: "Legal: White-label licensing, compiled binary IP, multi-tier sublicensing terms" status: pending - id: ibm-ai-integration content: "Phase 1 S-Tier: Watson/watsonx AI modules (Assistant, Discovery, NLP, ai, governance)" status: pending - id: ibm-security-integration content: "Phase 1 S-Tier: IBM Security modules (Verify, Guardium, QRadar, Trusteer)" status: pending - id: payments-vertical content: "Phase 2 S-Tier: Payment Processing vertical with 1-2 pilot tenants" status: pending - id: lending-vertical content: "Phase 2 S-Tier: Embedded Lending vertical with watsonx.governance MRM" status: pending - id: healthcare-vertical content: "Phase 2 S-Tier: Healthcare EHR vertical with HIPAA binary-as-artifact" status: pending --- # SaaS Composition Platform - Strategic Architecture ## Executive Summary A "CMS for SaaS" platform that treats WebAssembly modules as composable content, enabling multi-tier white-labeling where each downstream tenant receives a unique, optimized binary with only their licensed features compiled in. The platform leverages authorized reseller relationships with IBM PartnerWorld and Climb Channel Solutions to embed enterprise capabilities.--- ## Core Technology Stack ### Dual Binaryen Architecture ```mermaid flowchart TB subgraph buildTime [Build-Time Layer] BinaryenCosmo[binaryen.com
Cosmopolitan Native] BuildPipeline[CI/CD Build Pipeline] ModuleRegistry[Module Registry] end subgraph runtime [Runtime Layer] Redbean[redbean.com
Universal Server] BinaryenWasm[binaryen.wasm
In-Process Optimizer] LuaOrch[Lua Orchestration] SQLite[SQLite State] end subgraph outputs [Deployment Artifacts] TenantBinary[Tenant Binary
White-Labeled] ClientBinary[Client Binary
Sub-Labeled] AgentBinary[Agent Binary
Lightweight] end ModuleRegistry --> BinaryenCosmo BinaryenCosmo --> BuildPipeline BuildPipeline --> TenantBinary TenantBinary --> Redbean BinaryenWasm --> LuaOrch LuaOrch --> ClientBinary LuaOrch --> AgentBinary ``` **Native Binaryen (Cosmopolitan Build)** - Single `binaryen.com` binary runs on Linux, macOS, Windows, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, NetBSD - Full optimization suite: `wasm-merge`, `wasm-opt`, `wasm-ctor-eval`, `wasm-metadce` - Build pipeline use: tenant binary generation, CI/CD integration - Performance target: native speed for heavy optimization passes **WASM Binaryen (Self-Hosted)** - `binaryen.wasm` runs inside redbean's WASM runtime - Enables runtime module composition without external tooling - Tenant-safe: sandboxed execution, no filesystem access - Powers: hot module swapping, dynamic feature activation, client-side preview --- ## Platform Architecture ### Module Registry Structure ```javascript /registry/ Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ native/ # Your proprietary IP Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ core/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ auth.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ billing.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ api-gateway.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ data-layer.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ verticals/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ payments/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ healthcare/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ lending/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ observability/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ grc/ Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ commerce/ Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ frameworks/ # GRC frameworks Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ soc2-type2.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ hipaa.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ ... Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ ibm/ # IBM resold modules Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ watson/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ assistant.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ discovery.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ nlp.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ watsonx/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ ai.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ governance.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ data.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ security/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ verify.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ guardium.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ qradar.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ sterling/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ oms.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ fulfillment.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ inventory.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ climb/ # Climb Channel resold Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ thales/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ sailpoint/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ snowflake/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ hashicorp/ Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ ... Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ tenants/{tenant-id}/ # Tenant custom modules ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ custom/ ``` ### Composition Engine ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Admin as Tenant Admin participant Portal as Build Portal participant Registry as Module Registry participant Binaryen as Binaryen Engine participant Artifact as Artifact Store Admin->>Portal: Configure build (features, branding, config) Portal->>Registry: Resolve module dependencies Registry-->>Portal: Module list + entitlements Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-merge (combine modules) Binaryen-->>Portal: Merged module Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-ctor-eval (bake config) Note right of Binaryen: Brand, API keys, pricing
compiled into binary Binaryen-->>Portal: Configured module Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-opt -O3 (optimize + DCE) Note right of Binaryen: Dead code elimination
removes unlicensed features Binaryen-->>Portal: Optimized module Portal->>Portal: Package into redbean .com Portal->>Artifact: Store versioned binary Portal-->>Admin: Download link + manifest ``` ### Entitlement Model | Enforcement Type | Mechanism | Use Case | |-----------------|-----------|----------| | **Compile-Time** | Module not included in build | Feature tiers, unlicensed capabilities | | **Bake-Time** | `wasm-ctor-eval` embeds values | Branding, API keys, rate limits | | **Link-Time** | Dead code elimination removes paths | Unused integrations, regional features | | **Run-Time** | License server check | Seat counts, metered usage, expiration |--- ## IBM Integration Strategy (Aligned to Tiering) ### S Tier: AI + Security (Build First, Together) These are **foundational capabilities** that enable all S-tier verticals. | IBM Product | WASM Module | Tier | Enables | |-------------|-------------|------|---------| | Watson Assistant | `ibm/watson/assistant.wasm` | S-AI | Healthcare intake, lending support, payment help | | Watson Discovery | `ibm/watson/discovery.wasm` | S-AI | Clinical search, document intelligence | | Watson NLP | `ibm/watson/nlp.wasm` | S-AI | Entity extraction across all verticals | | watsonx.ai | `ibm/watsonx/ai.wasm` | S-AI | LLM inference, underwriting models | | watsonx.governance | `ibm/watsonx/governance.wasm` | S-AI | Model risk management (lending requirement) | | Verify | `ibm/security/verify.wasm` | S-Security | Auth for all verticals, 3DS for payments | | Guardium | `ibm/security/guardium.wasm` | S-Security | PHI monitoring (healthcare), PCI audit (payments) | | QRadar | `ibm/security/qradar.wasm` | S-Security | Threat detection, compliance evidence | | Trusteer | `ibm/security/trusteer.wasm` | S-Security | Fraud prevention (payments, lending) | **Licensing Model**: IBM Cloud Pak consumption-based, OEM embedding terms for compiled modules. ### A Tier: Observability + Commerce Enablers (Build Second) | IBM Product | WASM Module | Tier | Enables | |-------------|-------------|------|---------| | Instana | `ibm/observability/instana.wasm` | A-Observability | Full APM capabilities | | Turbonomic | `ibm/observability/turbonomic.wasm` | A-Observability | Resource optimization | | watsonx AIOps | `ibm/observability/aiops.wasm` | A-Observability | Incident correlation | | Sterling OMS | `ibm/sterling/oms.wasm` | A-Commerce | Complex order orchestration | | API Connect | `ibm/integration/apiconnect.wasm` | A-Commerce | API management | ### B Tier: Supply Chain + Process (Build Later) | IBM Product | WASM Module | Tier | Enables | |-------------|-------------|------|---------| | Sterling Fulfillment | `ibm/sterling/fulfillment.wasm` | B-SupplyChain | Fulfillment optimization | | Sterling Inventory | `ibm/sterling/inventory.wasm` | B-SupplyChain | Real-time ATP | | Cloud Pak Automation | `ibm/automation/cpba.wasm` | B-DevOps | Workflow, decisions | | Process Mining | `ibm/automation/processmining.wasm` | B-GRC | Control effectiveness | --- ## Climb Channel Integration Strategy (Aligned to Tiering) ### S Tier Vendors (Build First) | Category | Vendor | Products | Enables | |----------|--------|----------|---------| | **Security** | Thales | SafeNet HSM, CipherTrust | PCI tokenization (payments), encryption | | **Security** | CyberArk | Privileged Access | PAM for high-security tenants | | **Security** | Entrust | PKI, certificates | Document signing (healthcare, lending) | | **Fraud** | Alloy | Fraud orchestration | Lending application fraud | | **KYC** | Onfido/Socure | Identity verification | Merchant/borrower onboarding | | **Banking** | Plaid | Bank verification | ACH (payments), income (lending) | | **Credit** | Experian/Equifax/TU | Credit bureaus | Lending underwriting | | **Data** | Informatica | MDM | Patient matching (healthcare) | | **Privacy** | BigID | Data discovery | PHI/PII classification | ### A Tier Vendors (Build Second) | Category | Vendor | Products | Enables | |----------|--------|----------|---------| | **Identity** | SailPoint | IdentityNow | Access governance | | **Identity** | Ping Identity | PingOne, PingFederate | Alternative IAM | | **Search** | Algolia | Hosted search | Product search (commerce) | | **Payments** | Stripe/Adyen | Payment processing | Commerce checkout | | **Tax** | Avalara | Tax calculation | Commerce tax compliance | | **Shipping** | Shippo | Carrier rates | Commerce fulfillment | | **Observability** | Elastic | Elasticsearch, Kibana | Log aggregation | | **Observability** | Confluent | Kafka | Event streaming | | **Incidents** | PagerDuty | Incident management | Alerting | ### B Tier Vendors (Build Later) | Category | Vendor | Products | Enables | |----------|--------|----------|---------| | **GRC** | OneTrust | Privacy, GRC | Consent management | | **Vulnerability** | Qualys/Tenable | Scanning | Compliance evidence | | **Data** | Snowflake | Data Cloud | Analytics backend | | **Data** | Databricks | Lakehouse | ML/AI data platform | | **DevOps** | HashiCorp | Vault, Terraform | Secrets, IaC (internal) | | **DevOps** | JFrog | Artifactory | Module registry backend | | **DevOps** | GitLab | CI/CD | Build pipeline | --- ## Multi-Tier White-Label Model ```mermaid flowchart TB subgraph you [Your Corporation - Platform Provider] Core[Core Platform IP] IBM[IBM Modules - Resold] Climb[Climb Modules - Resold] end subgraph tenantA [Tenant A - PayFlow] TenantBuild[Composed Binary] TenantBrand[PayFlow Branding] TenantModules[Custom Modules] end subgraph clientX [Client X - GymPayments] ClientBuild[Sub-Composed Binary] ClientBrand[GymPayments Branding] end subgraph merchant [End Merchant - Downtown CrossFit] MerchantConfig[Merchant Config Baked In] end Core --> TenantBuild IBM --> TenantBuild Climb --> TenantBuild TenantBrand --> TenantBuild TenantModules --> TenantBuild TenantBuild --> ClientBuild ClientBrand --> ClientBuild ClientBuild --> MerchantConfig ``` ### Revenue Flow Per Transaction ```javascript Merchant pays: $500/month + 2.9% + $0.30/txn ΓöîΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÉ Γöé Your Corporation Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Platform fee: $50/month Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ IBM margin: ~20% on $75 wholesale = $15 Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Climb margin: ~25% on $60 wholesale = $15 Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ Per-txn: 0.05% + $0.01 Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöñ Γöé Tenant "PayFlow" Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Platform margin: $100/month Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Pass-through markup: $35 Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ Per-txn: 0.15% + $0.02 Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöñ Γöé Client "GymPayments" Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ Their margin: $185/month Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ Per-txn: 2.70% + $0.27 Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÿ ``` --- ## Strategic Tiering ```mermaid flowchart LR subgraph sTier [S Tier - Build First] AI[AI / Watson / watsonx] Payments[Payment Processing] Lending[Embedded Lending] Healthcare[Healthcare EHR] Security[Security] end subgraph aTier [A Tier - Build Second] Commerce[Headless Commerce] Observability[Observability / APM] Identity[Identity] end subgraph bTier [B Tier - Build Later] GRC[Compliance / GRC] Search[Search] Data[Data] DevOps[DevOps] SupplyChain[Supply Chain] end sTier --> aTier aTier --> bTier ``` --- ## S Tier: Verticals and Capabilities (Build First) ### AI (Watson / watsonx) - Foundational Capability | Component | IBM Product | Module | Integration | |-----------|-------------|--------|-------------| | Conversational | Watson Assistant | `ibm/watson/assistant.wasm` | Embedded in all customer-facing verticals | | Search/NLU | Watson Discovery | `ibm/watson/discovery.wasm` | Clinical search, document intelligence | | Language | Watson NLP | `ibm/watson/nlp.wasm` | Entity extraction, sentiment, classification | | Foundation Models | watsonx.ai | `ibm/watsonx/ai.wasm` | LLM inference, prompt engineering | | AI Governance | watsonx.governance | `ibm/watsonx/governance.wasm` | Model lineage, bias detection, MRM | | Data Platform | watsonx.data | `ibm/watsonx/data.wasm` | Lakehouse, Presto/Spark analytics | **Strategic Value**: AI modules are horizontal enablers across all verticals. Build once, compose everywhere. ### Payment Processing - **Core Modules**: Ledger, reconciliation, settlement, card processing, ACH, wire, real-time payments - **IBM Integration**: Trusteer (fraud), Verify (3DS/SCA), ODM (pricing rules, fraud rules) - **Climb Integration**: Thales HSM (PCI tokenization), Plaid (bank verification) - **Differentiator**: Fee structures compiled in, per-merchant optimized binaries, audit-proof pricing logic ### Embedded Lending / BNPL - **Core Modules**: Application intake, underwriting engine, origination, servicing, collections - **IBM Integration**: ODM (credit decisioning), watsonx.ai (ML underwriting), watsonx.governance (model risk management) - **Climb Integration**: Credit bureaus (Experian/Equifax/TransUnion), Plaid (income), Alloy (fraud orchestration) - **Differentiator**: Underwriting logic is compiled IP (cannot be reverse-engineered), fair lending provable via build manifest ### Healthcare EHR - **Core Modules**: Patient demographics, scheduling, clinical notes, orders, claims, billing - **IBM Integration**: Watson Discovery (clinical search), Watson NLP (clinical extraction), Guardium (PHI monitoring) - **Climb Integration**: Informatica MDM (patient matching), BigID (PHI discovery), DocuSign (consent) - **Differentiator**: HIPAA compliance baked into binary, specialty-specific builds (dental, veterinary, behavioral health) ### Security - Foundational Capability | Component | IBM Product | Module | Integration | |-----------|-------------|--------|-------------| | Identity/Auth | Verify | `ibm/security/verify.wasm` | OIDC/SAML, MFA, adaptive auth, passwordless | | Data Protection | Guardium | `ibm/security/guardium.wasm` | Data activity monitoring, audit trails | | SIEM | QRadar | `ibm/security/qradar.wasm` | Threat detection, security analytics | | Fraud | Trusteer | `ibm/security/trusteer.wasm` | Device fingerprinting, session protection | | Component | Climb Vendor | Module | Integration | |-----------|--------------|--------|-------------| | HSM/Encryption | Thales | `climb/thales/hsm.wasm` | Hardware security, tokenization | | PAM | CyberArk | `climb/cyberark/pam.wasm` | Privileged access management | | PKI | Entrust | `climb/entrust/pki.wasm` | Certificates, document signing | **Strategic Value**: Security modules are mandatory for regulated verticals (payments, lending, healthcare). Build robust, reuse everywhere. --- ## A Tier: Verticals and Capabilities (Build Second) ### Headless Commerce - **Core Modules**: Catalog, cart, checkout, orders, pricing (simple/volume/contract/subscription), inventory - **IBM Integration**: Sterling OMS (complex orders), Watson Assistant (shopping assistant), Watson Discovery (product search) - **Climb Integration**: Algolia (search), Stripe/Adyen (payments), Avalara (tax), Shippo (shipping) - **Differentiator**: B2B vs B2C vs subscription builds with dead code elimination, vertical-specific checkout flows ### Observability / APM - **Core Modules**: Collectors (OTLP, Prometheus, StatsD), processors, storage, query, alerting, dashboards - **IBM Integration**: Instana (full APM), Turbonomic (resource optimization), watsonx AIOps (correlation) - **Climb Integration**: Elastic (logs), Confluent Kafka (streaming), PagerDuty (incidents) - **Differentiator**: Single-file universal agent, protocol-specific builds, environment-specific (K8s, edge, VM) ### Identity - Horizontal Capability | Component | IBM Product | Module | Integration | |-----------|-------------|--------|-------------| | IAM | Verify | `ibm/security/verify.wasm` | (shared with Security tier) | | Component | Climb Vendor | Module | Integration | |-----------|--------------|--------|-------------| | IGA | SailPoint | `climb/sailpoint/identitynow.wasm` | Access governance, provisioning, certifications | | Federation | Ping Identity | `climb/ping/pingone.wasm` | Alternative IAM, workforce identity | **Strategic Value**: Identity bridges security (S-tier) and enables multi-tenant access patterns across all verticals. --- ## B Tier: Capabilities (Build Later) ### Compliance / GRC - **Core Modules**: Control framework, risk register, policy management, evidence collection, reporting - **Frameworks**: SOC2, ISO27001, PCI-DSS, HIPAA, GDPR, NIST, FedRAMP, SOX - **IBM Integration**: QRadar (SIEM evidence), Guardium (DAM evidence), Process Mining (control effectiveness) - **Climb Integration**: OneTrust (privacy), BigID (data discovery), Qualys/Tenable (vulnerability) - **Note**: Many GRC capabilities are embedded in S-tier verticals (healthcare HIPAA, payments PCI) ### Search - **Climb Integration**: Elastic (Elasticsearch), Algolia (hosted search) - **IBM Integration**: Watson Discovery (semantic search) - **Note**: Search is consumed by S/A tier verticals, not standalone ### Data - **Climb Integration**: Snowflake (warehouse), Databricks (lakehouse), Informatica (integration/MDM) - **IBM Integration**: watsonx.data (lakehouse) - **Note**: Data infrastructure supports analytics across verticals ### DevOps - **Climb Integration**: HashiCorp (Vault, Terraform, Consul), GitLab (CI/CD), JFrog (Artifactory) - **Note**: DevOps tooling is internal infrastructure, not customer-facing modules ### Supply Chain - **IBM Integration**: Sterling OMS, Sterling Fulfillment, Sterling Inventory - **Note**: Supply chain capabilities are consumed by Commerce (A-tier), not standalone vertical --- ## Implementation Phases (Aligned to S/A/B Tiering) ```mermaid gantt title Implementation Roadmap dateFormat YYYY-MM section Foundation Binaryen Cosmo Port :p0a, 2026-01, 3M Binaryen WASM Build :p0b, 2026-02, 2M Composition Engine MVP :p1, after p0a, 3M Tenant Management :p2, after p1, 2M section S Tier IBM AI + Security :s1, after p1, 4M Climb S-Tier Vendors :s2, after p1, 3M Payments Vertical :s3, after s1, 4M Lending Vertical :s4, after s3, 3M Healthcare Vertical :s5, after s4, 4M section A Tier Commerce Vertical :a1, after s5, 3M Observability Vertical :a2, after a1, 3M Identity Expansion :a3, after a2, 2M section B Tier GRC Capabilities :b1, after a3, 3M Data + DevOps :b2, after b1, 2M ``` ### Phase 0: Foundation (Months 1-5) **0.1 Binaryen Cosmopolitan Port** - Port Binaryen C++ codebase to build with Cosmopolitan Libc - Produce `binaryen.com` universal binary (runs on 6 OS targets) - Validate core tools: wasm-merge, wasm-opt, wasm-ctor-eval, wasm-metadce - Test performance parity with native builds **0.2 Binaryen WASM Self-Hosting** - Compile Binaryen to WASM using Emscripten or native wasm target - Integrate binaryen.wasm into redbean's WASM runtime - Enable runtime module composition without external processes - Validate sandboxed execution for tenant safety **0.3 Composition Engine MVP** - Lua orchestration layer in redbean - Module registry (filesystem-based, later JFrog Artifactory) - Build pipeline: resolve dependencies, merge, configure, optimize, package - CLI interface for builds - Simple web portal for configuration **0.4 Tenant Management** - Multi-tenant state in SQLite - Entitlement engine (compile-time module selection, bake-time config, runtime license checks) - Build artifact versioning and rollback - Tenant self-service portal - Build manifests and audit trails ### Phase 1: S Tier - AI + Security Foundation (Months 4-8) **1.1 IBM AI Integration** - Watson Assistant wrapper module (conversational AI) - Watson Discovery wrapper module (document search/NLU) - Watson NLP wrapper module (entity extraction, sentiment) - watsonx.ai integration (LLM inference endpoints) - watsonx.governance integration (model lineage, bias detection) - IBM Cloud Pak licensing integration and metering **1.2 IBM Security Integration** - Verify wrapper module (OIDC/SAML, MFA, adaptive auth) - Guardium wrapper module (data activity monitoring) - QRadar wrapper module (SIEM, threat detection) - Trusteer wrapper module (fraud, device fingerprinting) **1.3 Climb S-Tier Vendors** - Thales HSM integration (tokenization, encryption) - Plaid integration (bank verification, income) - Credit bureau integrations (Experian, Equifax, TransUnion) - Alloy/Socure integration (fraud orchestration, KYC) - BigID integration (PHI/PII discovery) - Informatica MDM integration (patient matching) ### Phase 2: S Tier - Verticals (Months 8-19) **2.1 Payment Processing Vertical** - Core modules: ledger, reconciliation, settlement, card processing - Integration: Trusteer fraud, Verify 3DS, Thales tokenization - Build configurations: ISO/PayFac, merchant, POS - Pilot: 1-2 payment platform tenants - White-label validation: 3-tier depth (platform > tenant > client > merchant) **2.2 Embedded Lending Vertical** - Core modules: application, underwriting, origination, servicing, collections - Integration: ODM decisioning, watsonx.ai ML models, watsonx.governance MRM - Integration: credit bureaus, Plaid income, Alloy fraud - Build configurations: consumer, SMB, merchant cash advance, BNPL - Pilot: 1-2 lending platform tenants **2.3 Healthcare EHR Vertical** - Core modules: demographics, scheduling, clinical notes, billing, claims - Integration: Watson Discovery clinical search, Watson NLP extraction, Guardium PHI - Integration: Informatica MDM, BigID PHI discovery - Build configurations: dental, veterinary, behavioral health, primary care - Pilot: 1-2 healthcare platform tenants - HIPAA compliance validation: binary-as-audit-artifact ### Phase 3: A Tier - Commerce, Observability, Identity (Months 19-27) **3.1 Headless Commerce Vertical** - Core modules: catalog, cart, checkout, orders, pricing, inventory - Integration: Sterling OMS, Watson search, Algolia, payments, tax - Build configurations: B2B wholesale, B2C DTC, subscription, marketplace - Pilot tenants **3.2 Observability/APM Vertical** - Core modules: collectors, processors, storage, alerting, dashboards - Integration: Instana, Turbonomic, Elastic, Kafka, PagerDuty - Build configurations: K8s, edge/IoT, VM, hybrid - Universal agent: single binary for all platforms - Pilot tenants **3.3 Identity Expansion** - SailPoint IdentityNow integration (governance, provisioning) - Ping Identity integration (alternative IAM) - Cross-vertical identity federation - B2B partner access patterns ### Phase 4: B Tier - Supporting Capabilities (Months 27-32) **4.1 Compliance/GRC** - Framework modules: SOC2, ISO27001, PCI-DSS, HIPAA, GDPR, NIST - Integration: OneTrust, Qualys/Tenable - Note: Much GRC capability already embedded in S-tier verticals **4.2 Data + DevOps Infrastructure** - Snowflake/Databricks analytics integration - HashiCorp Vault secrets management - JFrog Artifactory for module registry - GitLab CI/CD for build automation ### Phase 5: Scale (Months 32+) - Additional vertical specializations - Geographic expansion (EU data residency builds) - Marketplace for third-party modules - Enterprise features (SSO, advanced audit, custom compliance frameworks) - Partner ecosystem development --- ## Technical Risks and Mitigations | Risk | Impact | Mitigation | |------|--------|------------| | Binaryen Cosmopolitan port complexity | High | Start with C API subset, expand incrementally | | WASM-in-WASM performance | Medium | Use native for heavy ops, WASM for flexibility | | IBM licensing complexity | Medium | Engage IBM partner manager early, clarify OEM terms | | Module size bloat | Medium | Aggressive DCE, modular architecture | | Tenant isolation in shared builds | High | Compile-time separation, no runtime multi-tenancy |--- ## Success Metrics (By Phase) | Metric | Phase 0 (Foundation) | Phase 2 (S-Tier Verticals) | Phase 3 (A-Tier) | Phase 5 (Scale) | |--------|---------------------|---------------------------|------------------|-----------------| | Binary size (base) | < 10MB | < 15MB | < 20MB | < 25MB | | Build time (full) | < 30s | < 60s | < 90s | < 120s | | OS targets | 6 | 6 | 6 | 6 | | Module registry | 20 native | 80+ (native + IBM + Climb) | 150+ | 300+ | | IBM modules | 0 | 10 (AI + Security) | 15 | 20+ | | Climb integrations | 0 | 10 (S-tier vendors) | 20 | 40+ | | Active tenants | 0 (internal) | 3-6 pilots (payments, lending, healthcare) | 15+ | 50+ | | White-label depth | 2 tiers | 3 tiers validated | 4 tiers | Unlimited | | Revenue (ARR) | $0 | $500K (pilots) | $2M | $10M+ | ### Key Milestones | Milestone | Target Date | Success Criteria | |-----------|-------------|------------------| | Binaryen universal binary | Month 3 | wasm-opt runs on 6 OS targets from single binary | | Binaryen self-hosting | Month 4 | binaryen.wasm composes modules inside redbean | | First S-tier vertical pilot | Month 12 | Payment platform tenant live with white-label client | | Three S-tier verticals live | Month 19 | Payments, lending, healthcare all with pilot tenants | | IBM revenue recognition | Month 15 | First IBM resale margin realized | | Climb revenue recognition | Month 12 | First Climb resale margin realized | --- ## Next Steps (Immediate) ### Technical 1. **Binaryen Port Assessment**: Evaluate Binaryen C++ codebase for Cosmopolitan Libc compatibility 2. **Binaryen WASM Assessment**: Evaluate Emscripten vs native WASM target for self-hosting build 3. **Redbean Prototype**: Minimal Lua + WASM composition proof-of-concept ### Business 4. **IBM PartnerWorld**: Initiate/confirm partner tier, access technical resources, clarify OEM embedding terms 5. **Climb Channel Agreement**: Establish reseller agreement for S-tier vendors (Thales, Plaid, credit bureaus) 6. **Legal Review**: White-label licensing terms, compiled binary IP protection, multi-tier sublicensing ### Market Validation 7. **Vertical Discovery**: Identify 2-3 potential pilot tenants for payment processing vertical 8. **Pricing Model**: Develop platform fee + margin structure for multi-tier white-labeling

The platform leverages authorized reseller relationships with IBM PartnerWorld and Climb Channel Solutions to embed enterprise capabilities.--- ## Core Technology Stack ### Dual Binaryen Architecture ```mermaid flowchart TB subgraph buildTime [Build-Time Layer] BinaryenCosmo[binaryen.com
Cosmopolitan Native] BuildPipeline[CI/CD Build Pipeline] ModuleRegistry[Module Registry] end subgraph runtime [Runtime Layer] Redbean[redbean.com
Universal Server] BinaryenWasm[binaryen.wasm
In-Process Optimizer] LuaOrch[Lua Orchestration] SQLite[SQLite State] end subgraph outputs [Deployment Artifacts] TenantBinary[Tenant Binary
White-Labeled] ClientBinary[Client Binary
Sub-Labeled] AgentBinary[Agent Binary
Lightweight] end ModuleRegistry --> BinaryenCosmo BinaryenCosmo --> BuildPipeline BuildPipeline --> TenantBinary TenantBinary --> Redbean BinaryenWasm --> LuaOrch LuaOrch --> ClientBinary LuaOrch --> AgentBinary ``` **Native Binaryen (Cosmopolitan Build)** - Single `binaryen.com` binary runs on Linux, macOS, Windows, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, NetBSD - Full optimization suite: `wasm-merge`, `wasm-opt`, `wasm-ctor-eval`, `wasm-metadce` - Build pipeline use: tenant binary generation, CI/CD integration - Performance target: native speed for heavy optimization passes **WASM Binaryen (Self-Hosted)** - `binaryen.wasm` runs inside redbean's WASM runtime - Enables runtime module composition without external tooling - Tenant-safe: sandboxed execution, no filesystem access - Powers: hot module swapping, dynamic feature activation, client-side preview --- ## Platform Architecture ### Module Registry Structure ```javascript /registry/ Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ native/ # Your proprietary IP Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ core/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ auth.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ billing.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ api-gateway.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ data-layer.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ verticals/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ payments/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ healthcare/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ lending/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ observability/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ grc/ Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ commerce/ Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ frameworks/ # GRC frameworks Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ soc2-type2.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ hipaa.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ ... Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ ibm/ # IBM resold modules Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ watson/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ assistant.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ discovery.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ nlp.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ watsonx/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ ai.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ governance.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ data.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ security/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ verify.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ guardium.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ qradar.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ sterling/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ oms.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ fulfillment.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ inventory.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ climb/ # Climb Channel resold Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ thales/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ sailpoint/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ snowflake/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ hashicorp/ Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ ... Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ tenants/{tenant-id}/ # Tenant custom modules ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ custom/ ``` ### Composition Engine ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Admin as Tenant Admin participant Portal as Build Portal participant Registry as Module Registry participant Binaryen as Binaryen Engine participant Artifact as Artifact Store Admin->>Portal: Configure build (features, branding, config) Portal->>Registry: Resolve module dependencies Registry-->>Portal: Module list + entitlements Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-merge (combine modules) Binaryen-->>Portal: Merged module Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-ctor-eval (bake config) Note right of Binaryen: Brand, API keys, pricing
compiled into binary Binaryen-->>Portal: Configured module Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-opt -O3 (optimize + DCE) Note right of Binaryen: Dead code elimination
removes unlicensed features Binaryen-->>Portal: Optimized module Portal->>Portal: Package into redbean .com Portal->>Artifact: Store versioned binary Portal-->>Admin: Download link + manifest ``` ### Entitlement Model | Enforcement Type | Mechanism | Use Case | |-----------------|-----------|----------| | **Compile-Time** | Module not included in build | Feature tiers, unlicensed capabilities | | **Bake-Time** | `wasm-ctor-eval` embeds values | Branding, API keys, rate limits | | **Link-Time** | Dead code elimination removes paths | Unused integrations, regional features | | **Run-Time** | License server check | Seat counts, metered usage, expiration |--- ## IBM Integration Strategy (Aligned to Tiering) ### S Tier: AI + Security (Build First, Together) These are **foundational capabilities** that enable all S-tier verticals. | IBM Product | WASM Module | Tier | Enables | |-------------|-------------|------|---------| | Watson Assistant | `ibm/watson/assistant.wasm` | S-AI | Healthcare intake, lending support, payment help | | Watson Discovery | `ibm/watson/discovery.wasm` | S-AI | Clinical search, document intelligence | | Watson NLP | `ibm/watson/nlp.wasm` | S-AI | Entity extraction across all verticals | | watsonx.ai | `ibm/watsonx/ai.wasm` | S-AI | LLM inference, underwriting models | | watsonx.governance | `ibm/watsonx/governance.wasm` | S-AI | Model risk management (lending requirement) | | Verify | `ibm/security/verify.wasm` | S-Security | Auth for all verticals, 3DS for payments | | Guardium | `ibm/security/guardium.wasm` | S-Security | PHI monitoring (healthcare), PCI audit (payments) | | QRadar | `ibm/security/qradar.wasm` | S-Security | Threat detection, compliance evidence | | Trusteer | `ibm/security/trusteer.wasm` | S-Security | Fraud prevention (payments, lending) | **Licensing Model**: IBM Cloud Pak consumption-based, OEM embedding terms for compiled modules. ### A Tier: Observability + Commerce Enablers (Build Second) | IBM Product | WASM Module | Tier | Enables | |-------------|-------------|------|---------| | Instana | `ibm/observability/instana.wasm` | A-Observability | Full APM capabilities | | Turbonomic | `ibm/observability/turbonomic.wasm` | A-Observability | Resource optimization | | watsonx AIOps | `ibm/observability/aiops.wasm` | A-Observability | Incident correlation | | Sterling OMS | `ibm/sterling/oms.wasm` | A-Commerce | Complex order orchestration | | API Connect | `ibm/integration/apiconnect.wasm` | A-Commerce | API management | ### B Tier: Supply Chain + Process (Build Later) | IBM Product | WASM Module | Tier | Enables | |-------------|-------------|------|---------| | Sterling Fulfillment | `ibm/sterling/fulfillment.wasm` | B-SupplyChain | Fulfillment optimization | | Sterling Inventory | `ibm/sterling/inventory.wasm` | B-SupplyChain | Real-time ATP | | Cloud Pak Automation | `ibm/automation/cpba.wasm` | B-DevOps | Workflow, decisions | | Process Mining | `ibm/automation/processmining.wasm` | B-GRC | Control effectiveness | --- ## Climb Channel Integration Strategy (Aligned to Tiering) ### S Tier Vendors (Build First) | Category | Vendor | Products | Enables | |----------|--------|----------|---------| | **Security** | Thales | SafeNet HSM, CipherTrust | PCI tokenization (payments), encryption | | **Security** | CyberArk | Privileged Access | PAM for high-security tenants | | **Security** | Entrust | PKI, certificates | Document signing (healthcare, lending) | | **Fraud** | Alloy | Fraud orchestration | Lending application fraud | | **KYC** | Onfido/Socure | Identity verification | Merchant/borrower onboarding | | **Banking** | Plaid | Bank verification | ACH (payments), income (lending) | | **Credit** | Experian/Equifax/TU | Credit bureaus | Lending underwriting | | **Data** | Informatica | MDM | Patient matching (healthcare) | | **Privacy** | BigID | Data discovery | PHI/PII classification | ### A Tier Vendors (Build Second) | Category | Vendor | Products | Enables | |----------|--------|----------|---------| | **Identity** | SailPoint | IdentityNow | Access governance | | **Identity** | Ping Identity | PingOne, PingFederate | Alternative IAM | | **Search** | Algolia | Hosted search | Product search (commerce) | | **Payments** | Stripe/Adyen | Payment processing | Commerce checkout | | **Tax** | Avalara | Tax calculation | Commerce tax compliance | | **Shipping** | Shippo | Carrier rates | Commerce fulfillment | | **Observability** | Elastic | Elasticsearch, Kibana | Log aggregation | | **Observability** | Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöñ Γöé Client "GymPayments" Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÇΓöÿ ``` --- ## Strategic Tiering ```mermaid flowchart LR subgraph sTier [S Tier - Build First] AI[AI / Watson / watsonx] Payments[Payment Processing] Lending[Embedded Lending] Healthcare[Healthcare EHR] Security[Security] end subgraph aTier [A Tier - Build Second] Commerce[Headless Commerce] Observability[Observability / APM] Identity[Identity] end subgraph bTier [B Tier - Build Later] GRC[Compliance / GRC] Search[Search] Data[Data] DevOps[DevOps] SupplyChain[Supply Chain] end sTier --> aTier aTier --> bTier ``` --- ## S Tier: Verticals and Capabilities (Build First) ### AI (Watson / watsonx) - Foundational Capability | Component | IBM Product | Module | Integration | |-----------|-------------|--------|-------------| | Conversational | Watson Assistant | `ibm/watson/assistant.wasm` | Embedded in all customer-facing verticals | | Search/NLU | Watson Discovery | `ibm/watson/discovery.wasm` | Clinical search, document intelligence | | Language | Watson NLP | `ibm/watson/nlp.wasm` | Entity extraction, sentiment, classification | | Foundation Models | watsonx.ai | `ibm/watsonx/ai.wasm` | LLM inference, prompt engineering | | AI Governance | watsonx.governance | `ibm/watsonx/governance.wasm` | Model lineage, bias detection, MRM | | Data Platform | watsonx.data | `ibm/watsonx/data.wasm` | Lakehouse, Presto/Spark analytics | **Strategic Value**: AI modules are horizontal enablers across all verticals. Build once, compose everywhere. ### Payment Processing - **Core Modules**: Ledger, reconciliation, settlement, card processing, ACH, wire, real-time payments - **IBM Integration**: Trusteer (fraud), Verify (3DS/SCA), ODM (pricing rules, fraud rules) - **Climb Integration**: Thales HSM (PCI tokenization), Plaid (bank verification) - **Differentiator**: Fee structures compiled in, per-merchant optimized binaries, audit-proof pricing logic ### Embedded Lending / BNPL - **Core Modules**: Application intake, underwriting engine, origination, servicing, collections - **IBM Integration**: ODM (credit decisioning), watsonx.ai (ML underwriting), watsonx.governance (model risk management) - **Climb Integration**: Credit bureaus (Experian/Equifax/TransUnion), Plaid (income), Alloy (fraud orchestration) - **Differentiator**: Underwriting logic is compiled IP (cannot be reverse-engineered), fair lending provable via build manifest ### Healthcare EHR - **Core Modules**: Patient demographics, scheduling, clinical notes, orders, claims, billing - **IBM Integration**: Watson Discovery (clinical search), Watson NLP (clinical extraction), Guardium (PHI monitoring) - **Climb Integration**: Informatica MDM (patient matching), BigID (PHI discovery), DocuSign (consent) - **Differentiator**: HIPAA compliance baked into binary, specialty-specific builds (dental, veterinary, behavioral health) ### Security - Foundational Capability | Component | IBM Product | Module | Integration | |-----------|-------------|--------|-------------| | Identity/Auth | Verify | `ibm/security/verify.wasm` | OIDC/SAML, MFA, adaptive auth, passwordless | | Data Protection | Guardium | `ibm/security/guardium.wasm` | Data activity monitoring, audit trails | | SIEM | QRadar | `ibm/security/qradar.wasm` | Threat detection, security analytics | | Fraud | Trusteer | `ibm/security/trusteer.wasm` | Device fingerprinting, session protection | | Component | Climb Vendor | Module | Integration | |-----------|--------------|--------|-------------| | HSM/Encryption | Thales | `climb/thales/hsm.wasm` | Hardware security, tokenization | | PAM | CyberArk | `climb/cyberark/pam.wasm` | Privileged access management | | PKI | Entrust | `climb/entrust/pki.wasm` | Certificates, document signing | **Strategic Value**: Security modules are mandatory for regulated verticals (payments, lending, healthcare). Build robust, reuse everywhere. --- ## A Tier: Verticals and Capabilities (Build Second) ### Headless Commerce - **Core Modules**: Catalog, cart, checkout, orders, pricing (simple/volume/contract/subscription), inventory - **IBM Integration**: Sterling OMS (complex orders), Watson Assistant (shopping assistant), Watson Discovery (product search) - **Climb Integration**: Algolia (search), Stripe/Adyen (payments), Avalara (tax), Shippo (shipping) - **Differentiator**: B2B vs B2C vs subscription builds with dead code elimination, vertical-specific checkout flows ### Observability / APM - **Core Modules**: Collectors (OTLP, Prometheus, StatsD), processors, storage, query, alerting, dashboards - **IBM Integration**: Instana (full APM), Turbonomic (resource optimization), watsonx AIOps (correlation) - **Climb Integration**: Elastic (logs), Confluent Kafka (streaming), PagerDuty (incidents) - **Differentiator**: Single-file universal agent, protocol-specific builds, environment-specific (K8s, edge, VM) ### Identity - Horizontal Capability | Component | IBM Product | Module | Integration | |-----------|-------------|--------|-------------| | IAM | Verify | `ibm/security/verify.wasm` | (shared with Security tier) | | Component | Climb Vendor | Module | Integration | |-----------|--------------|--------|-------------| | IGA | SailPoint | `climb/sailpoint/identitynow.wasm` | Access governance, provisioning, certifications | | Federation | Ping Identity | `climb/ping/pingone.wasm` | Alternative IAM, workforce identity | **Strategic Value**: Identity bridges security (S-tier) and enables multi-tenant access patterns across all verticals. --- ## B Tier: Capabilities (Build Later) ### Compliance / GRC - **Core Modules**: Control framework, risk register, policy management, evidence collection, reporting - **Frameworks**: SOC2, ISO27001, PCI-DSS, HIPAA, GDPR, NIST, FedRAMP, SOX - **IBM Integration**: QRadar (SIEM evidence), Guardium (DAM evidence), Process Mining (control effectiveness) - **Climb Integration**: OneTrust (privacy), BigID (data discovery), Qualys/Tenable (vulnerability) - **Note**: Many GRC capabilities are embedded in S-tier verticals (healthcare HIPAA, payments PCI) ### Search - **Climb Integration**: Elastic (Elasticsearch), Algolia (hosted search) - **IBM Integration**: Watson Discovery (semantic search) - **Note**: Search is consumed by S/A tier verticals, not standalone ### Data - **Climb Integration**: Snowflake (warehouse), Databricks (lakehouse), Informatica (integration/MDM) - **IBM Integration**: watsonx.data (lakehouse) - **Note**: Data infrastructure supports analytics across verticals ### DevOps - **Climb Integration**: HashiCorp (Vault, Terraform, Consul), GitLab (CI/CD), JFrog (Artifactory) - **Note**: DevOps tooling is internal infrastructure, not customer-facing modules ### Supply Chain - **IBM Integration**: Sterling OMS, Sterling Fulfillment, Sterling Inventory - **Note**: Supply chain capabilities are consumed by Commerce (A-tier), not standalone vertical --- ## Implementation Phases (Aligned to S/A/B Tiering) ```mermaid gantt title Implementation Roadmap dateFormat YYYY-MM section Foundation Binaryen Cosmo Port :p0a, 2026-01, 3M Binaryen WASM Build :p0b, 2026-02, 2M Composition Engine MVP :p1, after p0a, 3M Tenant Management :p2, after p1, 2M section S Tier IBM AI + Security :s1, after p1, 4M Climb S-Tier Vendors :s2, after p1, 3M Payments Vertical :s3, after s1, 4M Lending Vertical :s4, after s3, 3M Healthcare Vertical :s5, after s4, 4M section A Tier Commerce Vertical :a1, after s5, 3M Observability Vertical :a2, after a1, 3M Identity Expansion :a3, after a2, 2M section B Tier GRC Capabilities :b1, after a3, 3M Data + DevOps :b2, after b1, 2M ``` ### Phase 0: Foundation (Months 1-5) **0.1 Binaryen Cosmopolitan Port** - Port Binaryen C++ codebase to build with Cosmopolitan Libc - Produce `binaryen.com` universal binary (runs on 6 OS targets) - Validate core tools: wasm-merge, wasm-opt, wasm-ctor-eval, wasm-metadce - Test performance parity with native builds **0.2 Binaryen WASM Self-Hosting** - Compile Binaryen to WASM using Emscripten or native wasm target - Integrate binaryen.wasm into redbean's WASM runtime - Enable runtime module composition without external processes - Validate sandboxed execution for tenant safety **0.3 Composition Engine MVP** - Lua orchestration layer in redbean - Module registry (filesystem-based, later JFrog Artifactory) - Build pipeline: resolve dependencies, merge, configure, optimize, package - CLI interface for builds - Simple web portal for configuration **0.4 Tenant Management** - Multi-tenant state in SQLite - Entitlement engine (compile-time module selection, bake-time config, runtime license checks) - Build artifact versioning and rollback - Tenant self-service portal - Build manifests and audit trails ### Phase 1: S Tier - AI + Security Foundation (Months 4-8) **1.1 IBM AI Integration** - Watson Assistant wrapper module (conversational AI) - Watson Discovery wrapper module (document search/NLU) - Watson NLP wrapper module (entity extraction, sentiment) - watsonx.ai integration (LLM inference endpoints) - watsonx.governance integration (model lineage, bias detection) - IBM Cloud Pak licensing integration and metering **1.2 IBM Security Integration** - Verify wrapper module (OIDC/SAML, MFA, adaptive auth) - Guardium wrapper module (data activity monitoring) - QRadar wrapper module (SIEM, threat detection) - Trusteer wrapper module (fraud, device fingerprinting) **1.3 Climb S-Tier Vendors** - Thales HSM integration (tokenization, encryption) - Plaid integration (bank verification, income) - Credit bureau integrations (Experian, Equifax, TransUnion) - Alloy/Socure integration (fraud orchestration, KYC) - BigID integration (PHI/PII discovery) - Informatica MDM integration (patient matching) ### Phase 2: S Tier - Verticals (Months 8-19) **2.1 Payment Processing Vertical** - Core modules: ledger, reconciliation, settlement, card processing - Integration: Trusteer fraud, Verify 3DS, Thales tokenization - Build configurations: ISO/PayFac, merchant, POS - Pilot: 1-2 payment platform tenants - White-label validation: 3-tier depth (platform > tenant > client > merchant) **2.2 Embedded Lending Vertical** - Core modules: application, underwriting, origination, servicing, collections - Integration: ODM decisioning, watsonx.ai ML models, watsonx.governance MRM - Integration: credit bureaus, Plaid income, Alloy fraud - Build configurations: consumer, SMB, merchant cash advance, BNPL - Pilot: 1-2 lending platform tenants **2.3 Healthcare EHR Vertical** - Core modules: demographics, scheduling, clinical notes, billing, claims - Integration: Watson Discovery clinical search, Watson NLP extraction, Guardium PHI - Integration: Informatica MDM, BigID PHI discovery - Build configurations: dental, veterinary, behavioral health, primary care - Pilot: 1-2 healthcare platform tenants - HIPAA compliance validation: binary-as-audit-artifact ### Phase 3: A Tier - Commerce, Observability, Identity (Months 19-27) **3.1 Headless Commerce Vertical** - Core modules: catalog, cart, checkout, orders, pricing, inventory - Integration: Sterling OMS, Watson search, Algolia, payments, tax - Build configurations: B2B wholesale, B2C DTC, subscription, marketplace - Pilot tenants **3.2 Observability/APM Vertical** - Core modules: collectors, processors, storage, alerting, dashboards - Integration: Instana, Turbonomic, Elastic, Kafka, PagerDuty - Build configurations: K8s, edge/IoT, VM, hybrid - Universal agent: single binary for all platforms - Pilot tenants **3.3 Identity Expansion** - SailPoint IdentityNow integration (governance, provisioning) - Ping Identity integration (alternative IAM) - Cross-vertical identity federation - B2B partner access patterns ### Phase 4: B Tier - Supporting Capabilities (Months 27-32) **4.1 Compliance/GRC** - Framework modules: SOC2, ISO27001, PCI-DSS, HIPAA, GDPR, NIST - Integration: OneTrust, Qualys/Tenable - Note: Much GRC capability already embedded in S-tier verticals **4.2 Data + DevOps Infrastructure** - Snowflake/Databricks analytics integration - HashiCorp Vault secrets management - JFrog Artifactory for module registry - GitLab CI/CD for build automation ### Phase 5: Scale (Months 32+) - Additional vertical specializations - Geographic expansion (EU data residency builds) - Marketplace for third-party modules - Enterprise features (SSO, advanced audit, custom compliance frameworks) - Partner ecosystem development --- ## Technical Risks and Mitigations | Risk | Impact | Mitigation | |------|--------|------------| | Binaryen Cosmopolitan port complexity | High | Start with C API subset, expand incrementally | | WASM-in-WASM performance | Medium | Use native for heavy ops, WASM for flexibility | | IBM licensing complexity | Medium | Engage IBM partner manager early, clarify OEM terms | | Module size bloat | Medium | Aggressive DCE, modular architecture | | Tenant isolation in shared builds | High | Compile-time separation, no runtime multi-tenancy |--- ## Success Metrics (By Phase) | Metric | Phase 0 (Foundation) | Phase 2 (S-Tier Verticals) | Phase 3 (A-Tier) | Phase 5 (Scale) | |--------|---------------------|---------------------------|------------------|-----------------| | Binary size (base) | < 10MB | < 15MB | < 20MB | < 25MB | | Build time (full) | < 30s | < 60s | < 90s | < 120s | | OS targets | 6 | 6 | 6 | 6 | | Module registry | 20 native | 80+ (native + IBM + Climb) | 150+ | 300+ | | IBM modules | 0 | 10 (AI + Security) | 15 | 20+ | | Climb integrations | 0 | 10 (S-tier vendors) | 20 | 40+ | | Active tenants | 0 (internal) | 3-6 pilots (payments, lending, healthcare) | 15+ | 50+ | | White-label depth | 2 tiers | 3 tiers validated | 4 tiers | Unlimited | | Revenue (ARR) | $0 | $500K (pilots) | $2M | $10M+ | ### Key Milestones | Milestone | Target Date | Success Criteria | |-----------|-------------|------------------| | Binaryen universal binary | Month 3 | wasm-opt runs on 6 OS targets from single binary | | Binaryen self-hosting | Month 4 | binaryen.wasm composes modules inside redbean | | First S-tier vertical pilot | Month 12 | Payment platform tenant live with white-label client | | Three S-tier verticals live | Month 19 | Payments, lending, healthcare all with pilot tenants | | IBM revenue recognition | Month 15 | First IBM resale margin realized | | Climb revenue recognition | Month 12 | First Climb resale margin realized | --- ## Next Steps (Immediate) ### Technical 1. **Binaryen Port Assessment**: Evaluate Binaryen C++ codebase for Cosmopolitan Libc compatibility 2. **Binaryen WASM Assessment**: Evaluate Emscripten vs native WASM target for self-hosting build 3. **Redbean Prototype**: Minimal Lua + WASM composition proof-of-concept ### Business 4. **IBM PartnerWorld**: Initiate/confirm partner tier, access technical resources, clarify OEM embedding terms 5. **Climb Channel Agreement**: Establish reseller agreement for S-tier vendors (Thales, Plaid, credit bureaus) 6. **Legal Review**: White-label licensing terms, compiled binary IP protection, multi-tier sublicensing ### Market Validation 7. **Vertical Discovery**: Identify 2-3 potential pilot tenants for payment processing vertical 8. **Pricing Model**: Develop platform fee + margin structure for multi-tier white-labeling"}

--- name: SaaS Composition Platform Strategy overview: Strategic architecture document for a universal SaaS composition platform using Binaryen (dual native + WASM deployment) with Redbean/Cosmopolitan, enabling multi-tier white-label distribution through IBM and Climb Channel partnerships. todos: - id: binaryen-cosmo-assessment content: Assess Binaryen C++ codebase for Cosmopolitan Libc compatibility status: pending - id: binaryen-wasm-assessment content: Evaluate compiling Binaryen to WASM for self-hosting capability status: pending - id: ibm-partner-enrollment content: Initiate/confirm IBM PartnerWorld tier and access technical resources status: pending - id: climb-reseller-agreement content: Establish Climb Channel reseller agreement for priority vendors status: pending - id: legal-review content: Legal review of white-label licensing and compiled binary IP protection status: pending - id: redbean-lua-prototype content: Build minimal redbean + Lua + WASM composition proof-of-concept status: pending --- # SaaS Composition Platform - Strategic Architecture ## Executive Summary A "CMS for SaaS" platform that treats WebAssembly modules as composable content, enabling multi-tier white-labeling where each downstream tenant receives a unique, optimized binary with only their licensed features compiled in. The platform leverages authorized reseller relationships with IBM PartnerWorld and Climb Channel Solutions to embed enterprise capabilities.--- ## Core Technology Stack ### Dual Binaryen Architecture ```mermaid flowchart TB subgraph buildTime [Build-Time Layer] BinaryenCosmo[binaryen.com
Cosmopolitan Native] BuildPipeline[CI/CD Build Pipeline] ModuleRegistry[Module Registry] end subgraph runtime [Runtime Layer] Redbean[redbean.com
Universal Server] BinaryenWasm[binaryen.wasm
In-Process Optimizer] LuaOrch[Lua Orchestration] SQLite[SQLite State] end subgraph outputs [Deployment Artifacts] TenantBinary[Tenant Binary
White-Labeled] ClientBinary[Client Binary
Sub-Labeled] AgentBinary[Agent Binary
Lightweight] end ModuleRegistry --> BinaryenCosmo BinaryenCosmo --> BuildPipeline BuildPipeline --> TenantBinary TenantBinary --> Redbean BinaryenWasm --> LuaOrch LuaOrch --> ClientBinary LuaOrch --> AgentBinary ``` **Native Binaryen (Cosmopolitan Build)** - Single `binaryen.com` binary runs on Linux, macOS, Windows, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, NetBSD - Full optimization suite: `wasm-merge`, `wasm-opt`, `wasm-ctor-eval`, `wasm-metadce` - Build pipeline use: tenant binary generation, CI/CD integration - Performance target: native speed for heavy optimization passes **WASM Binaryen (Self-Hosted)** - `binaryen.wasm` runs inside redbean's WASM runtime - Enables runtime module composition without external tooling - Tenant-safe: sandboxed execution, no filesystem access - Powers: hot module swapping, dynamic feature activation, client-side preview --- ## Platform Architecture ### Module Registry Structure ```javascript /registry/ Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ native/ # Your proprietary IP Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ core/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ auth.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ billing.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ api-gateway.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ data-layer.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ verticals/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ payments/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ healthcare/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ lending/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ observability/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ grc/ Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ commerce/ Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ frameworks/ # GRC frameworks Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ soc2-type2.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ hipaa.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ ... Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ ibm/ # IBM resold modules Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ watson/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ assistant.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ discovery.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ nlp.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ watsonx/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ ai.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ governance.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ data.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ security/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ verify.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ guardium.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ qradar.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ sterling/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ oms.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ fulfillment.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ inventory.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ climb/ # Climb Channel resold Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ thales/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ sailpoint/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ snowflake/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ hashicorp/ Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ ... Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ tenants/{tenant-id}/ # Tenant custom modules ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ custom/ ``` ### Composition Engine ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Admin as Tenant Admin participant Portal as Build Portal participant Registry as Module Registry participant Binaryen as Binaryen Engine participant Artifact as Artifact Store Admin->>Portal: Configure build (features, branding, config) Portal->>Registry: Resolve module dependencies Registry-->>Portal: Module list + entitlements Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-merge (combine modules) Binaryen-->>Portal: Merged module Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-ctor-eval (bake config) Note right of Binaryen: Brand, API keys, pricing
compiled into binary Binaryen-->>Portal: Configured module Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-opt -O3 (optimize + DCE) Note right of Binaryen: Dead code elimination
removes unlicensed features Binaryen-->>Portal: Optimized module Portal->>Portal: Package into redbean .com Portal->>Artifact: Store versioned binary Portal-->>Admin: Download link + manifest ``` ### Entitlement Model | Enforcement Type | Mechanism | Use Case | |-----------------|-----------|----------| | **Compile-Time** | Module not included in build | Feature tiers, unlicensed capabilities | | Data[Data] DevOps[DevOps] SupplyChain[Supply Chain] end sTier --> aTier aTier --> bTier ``` --- ## S Tier: Verticals and Capabilities (Build First) ### AI (Watson / watsonx) - Foundational Capability | Component | IBM Product | Module | Integration | |-----------|-------------|--------|-------------| | Conversational | Watson Assistant | `ibm/watson/assistant.wasm` | Embedded in all customer-facing verticals | | Search/NLU | Watson Discovery | `ibm/watson/discovery.wasm` | Clinical search, document intelligence | | Language | Watson NLP | `ibm/watson/nlp.wasm` | Entity extraction, sentiment, classification | | Foundation Models | watsonx.ai | `ibm/watsonx/ai.wasm` | LLM inference, prompt engineering | | AI Governance | watsonx.governance | `ibm/watsonx/governance.wasm` | Model lineage, bias detection, MRM | | Data Platform | watsonx.data | `ibm/watsonx/data.wasm` | Lakehouse, Presto/Spark analytics | **Strategic Value**: AI modules are horizontal enablers across all verticals. Build once, compose everywhere. ### Payment Processing - **Core Modules**: Ledger, reconciliation, settlement, card processing, ACH, wire, real-time payments - **IBM Integration**: Trusteer (fraud), Verify (3DS/SCA), ODM (pricing rules, fraud rules) - **Climb Integration**: Thales HSM (PCI tokenization), Plaid (bank verification) - **Differentiator**: Fee structures compiled in, per-merchant optimized binaries, audit-proof pricing logic ### Embedded Lending / BNPL - **Core Modules**: Application intake, underwriting engine, origination, servicing, collections - **IBM Integration**: ODM (credit decisioning), watsonx.ai (ML underwriting), watsonx.governance (model risk management) - **Climb Integration**: Credit bureaus (Experian/Equifax/TransUnion), Plaid (income), Alloy (fraud orchestration) - **Differentiator**: Underwriting logic is compiled IP (cannot be reverse-engineered), fair lending provable via build manifest ### Healthcare EHR - **Core Modules**: Patient demographics, scheduling, clinical notes, orders, claims, billing - **IBM Integration**: Watson Discovery (clinical search), Watson NLP (clinical extraction), Guardium (PHI monitoring) - **Climb Integration**: Informatica MDM (patient matching), BigID (PHI discovery), DocuSign (consent) - **Differentiator**: HIPAA compliance baked into binary, specialty-specific builds (dental, veterinary, behavioral health) ### Security - Foundational Capability | Component | IBM Product | Module | Integration | |-----------|-------------|--------|-------------| | Identity/Auth | Verify | `ibm/security/verify.wasm` | OIDC/SAML, MFA, adaptive auth, passwordless | | Data Protection | Guardium | `ibm/security/guardium.wasm` | Data activity monitoring, audit trails | | SIEM | QRadar | `ibm/security/qradar.wasm` | Threat detection, security analytics | | Fraud | Trusteer | `ibm/security/trusteer.wasm` | Device fingerprinting, session protection | | Component | Climb Vendor | Module | Integration | |-----------|--------------|--------|-------------| | HSM/Encryption | Thales | `climb/thales/hsm.wasm` | Hardware security, tokenization | | PAM | CyberArk | `climb/cyberark/pam.wasm` | Privileged access management | | PKI | Entrust | `climb/entrust/pki.wasm` | Certificates, document signing | **Strategic Value**: Security modules are mandatory for regulated verticals (payments, lending, healthcare). Build robust, reuse everywhere. --- ## A Tier: Verticals and Capabilities (Build Second) ### Headless Commerce - **Core Modules**: Catalog, cart, checkout, orders, pricing (simple/volume/contract/subscription), inventory - **IBM Integration**: Sterling OMS (complex orders), Watson Assistant (shopping assistant), Watson Discovery (product search) - **Climb Integration**: Algolia (search), Stripe/Adyen (payments), Avalara (tax), Shippo (shipping) - **Differentiator**: B2B vs B2C vs subscription builds with dead code elimination, vertical-specific checkout flows ### Observability / APM - **Core Modules**: Collectors (OTLP, Prometheus, StatsD), processors, storage, query, alerting, dashboards - **IBM Integration**: Instana (full APM), Turbonomic (resource optimization), watsonx AIOps (correlation) - **Climb Integration**: Elastic (logs), Confluent Kafka (streaming), PagerDuty (incidents) - **Differentiator**: Single-file universal agent, protocol-specific builds, environment-specific (K8s, edge, VM) ### Identity - Horizontal Capability | Component | IBM Product | Module | Integration | |-----------|-------------|--------|-------------| | IAM | Verify | `ibm/security/verify.wasm` | (shared with Security tier) | | Component | Climb Vendor | Module | Integration | |-----------|--------------|--------|-------------| | IGA | SailPoint | `climb/sailpoint/identitynow.wasm` | Access governance, provisioning, certifications | | Federation | Ping Identity | `climb/ping/pingone.wasm` | Alternative IAM, workforce identity | **Strategic Value**: Identity bridges security (S-tier) and enables multi-tenant access patterns across all verticals. --- ## B Tier: Capabilities (Build Later) ### Compliance / GRC - **Core Modules**: Control framework, risk register, policy management, evidence collection, reporting - **Frameworks**: SOC2, ISO27001, PCI-DSS, HIPAA, GDPR, NIST, FedRAMP, SOX - **IBM Integration**: QRadar (SIEM evidence), Guardium (DAM evidence), Process Mining (control effectiveness) - **Climb Integration**: OneTrust (privacy), BigID (data discovery), Qualys/Tenable (vulnerability) - **Note**: Many GRC capabilities are embedded in S-tier verticals (healthcare HIPAA, payments PCI) ### Search - **Climb Integration**: Elastic (Elasticsearch), Algolia (hosted search) - **IBM Integration**: Watson Discovery (semantic search) - **Note**: Search is consumed by S/A tier verticals, not standalone ### Data - **Climb Integration**: Snowflake (warehouse), Databricks (lakehouse), Informatica (integration/MDM) - **IBM Integration**: watsonx.data (lakehouse) - **Note**: Data infrastructure supports analytics across verticals ### DevOps - **Climb Integration**: HashiCorp (Vault, Terraform, Consul), GitLab (CI/CD), JFrog (Artifactory) - **Note**: DevOps tooling is internal infrastructure, not customer-facing modules ### Supply Chain - **IBM Integration**: Sterling OMS, Sterling Fulfillment, Sterling Inventory - **Note**: Supply chain capabilities are consumed by Commerce (A-tier), not standalone vertical --- ## Implementation Phases ### Phase 0: Binaryen Cosmopolitan Port (Foundation) - Port Binaryen C++ codebase to build with Cosmopolitan Libc - Produce `binaryen.com` universal binary - Validate: wasm-merge, wasm-opt, wasm-ctor-eval, wasm-metadce - Secondary: Compile Binaryen to WASM for self-hosting capability ### Phase 1: Composition Engine MVP - Lua orchestration layer in redbean - Module registry (filesystem-based initially, JFrog later) - Build pipeline: merge, configure, optimize, package - CLI and simple web portal ### Phase 2: Tenant Management - Multi-tenant state in SQLite - Entitlement engine (compile-time and runtime) - Build artifact versioning and rollback - Tenant self-service portal ### Phase 3: IBM Watson Integration - Watson Assistant wrapper module - Watson Discovery wrapper module - watsonx.ai inference integration - IBM Cloud Pak licensing integration ### Phase 4: Vertical Pilot - Select one vertical (based on market opportunity) - Build vertical-specific modules - Onboard 1-3 pilot tenants - Validate white-label depth ### Phase 5: Climb Channel Expansion - Integrate priority Climb vendors - Establish volume discount tiers - NFR program for demos - Co-marketing with vendors ### Phase 6: Scale and Replicate - Additional verticals - Geographic expansion (EU data residency) - Enterprise features (SSO, audit, compliance) - Marketplace for third-party modules --- ## Technical Risks and Mitigations | Risk | Impact | Mitigation | |------|--------|------------| | Binaryen Cosmopolitan port complexity | High | Start with C API subset, expand incrementally | | WASM-in-WASM performance | Medium | Use native for heavy ops, WASM for flexibility | | IBM licensing complexity | Medium | Engage IBM partner manager early, clarify OEM terms | | Module size bloat | Medium | Aggressive DCE, modular architecture | | Tenant isolation in shared builds | High | Compile-time separation, no runtime multi-tenancy |--- ## Success Metrics | Metric | Phase 1 Target | Phase 4 Target | |--------|----------------|----------------| | Binary size (base platform) | < 10MB | < 15MB | | Build time (full composition) | < 30s | < 60s | | Supported OS targets | 6 (via Cosmopolitan) | 6 | | Module registry size | 20 modules | 100+ modules | | Active tenants | 0 (internal) | 3-5 pilots |--- ## Next Steps (Immediate) 1. **Binaryen Port Assessment**: Evaluate Binaryen codebase for Cosmopolitan compatibility 2. **IBM PartnerWorld Enrollment**: Initiate/confirm partner tier, access to technical resources 3. **Climb Reseller Agreement**: Establish vendor access for priority integrations 4. **Legal Review**: White-label licensing terms, IP protection for compiled binaries

| IBM Product | WASM Module | Tier | Enables |
|-------------|-------------|------|---------|
| Instana | `ibm/observability/instana.wasm` | A-Observability | Full APM capabilities |
| Turbonomic | `ibm/observability/turbonomic.wasm` | A-Observability | Resource optimization |
| watsonx AIOps | `ibm/observability/aiops.wasm` | A-Observability | Incident correlation |
| Sterling OMS | `ibm/sterling/oms.wasm` | A-Commerce | Complex order orchestration |
| API Connect | `ibm/integration/apiconnect.wasm` | A-Commerce | API management |

### B Tier: Supply Chain + Process (Build Later)

| IBM Product | WASM Module | Tier | Enables |
|-------------|-------------|------|---------|
| Sterling Fulfillment | `ibm/sterling/fulfillment.wasm` | B-SupplyChain | Fulfillment optimization |
| Sterling Inventory | `ibm/sterling/inventory.wasm` | B-SupplyChain | Real-time ATP |
| Cloud Pak Automation | `ibm/automation/cpba.wasm` | B-DevOps | Workflow, decisions |
| Process Mining | `ibm/automation/processmining.wasm` | B-GRC | Control effectiveness |

---

## Climb Channel Integration Strategy (Aligned to Tiering)

### S Tier Vendors (Build First)

| Category | Vendor | Products | Enables |
|----------|--------|----------|---------|
| **Security** | Thales | SafeNet HSM, CipherTrust | PCI tokenization (payments), encryption |
| **Security** | CyberArk | Privileged Access | PAM for high-security tenants |
| **Security** | Entrust | PKI, certificates | Document signing (healthcare, lending) |
| **Fraud** | Alloy | Fraud orchestration | Lending application fraud |
| **KYC** | Onfido/Socure | Identity verification | Merchant/borrower onboarding |
| **Banking** | Plaid | Bank verification | ACH (payments), income (lending) |
| **Credit** | Experian/Equifax/TU | Credit bureaus | Lending underwriting |
| **Data** | Informatica | MDM | Patient matching (healthcare) |
| **Privacy** | BigID | Data discovery | PHI/PII classification |

### A Tier Vendors (Build Second)

| Category | Vendor | Products | Enables |
|----------|--------|----------|---------|
| **Identity** | SailPoint | IdentityNow | Access governance |
| **Identity** | Ping Identity | PingOne, PingFederate | Alternative IAM |
| **Search** | Algolia | Hosted search | Product search (commerce) |
| **Payments** | Stripe/Adyen | Payment processing | Commerce checkout |
| **Tax** | Avalara | Tax calculation | Commerce tax compliance |
| **Shipping** | Shippo | Carrier rates | Commerce fulfillment |
| **Observability** | Elastic | Elasticsearch, Kibana | Log aggregation |
| **Observability** | Confluent | Kafka | Event streaming |
| **Incidents** | PagerDuty | Incident management | Alerting |

### B Tier Vendors (Build Later)

| Category | Vendor | Products | Enables |
|----------|--------|----------|---------|
| **GRC** | OneTrust | Privacy, GRC | Consent management |
| **Vulnerability** | Qualys/Tenable | Scanning | Compliance evidence |
| **Data** | Snowflake | Data Cloud | Analytics backend |
| **Data** | Databricks | Lakehouse | ML/AI data platform |
| **DevOps** | HashiCorp | Vault, Terraform | Secrets, IaC (internal) |
| **DevOps** | JFrog | Artifactory | Module registry backend |
| **DevOps** | GitLab | CI/CD | Build pipeline |

id: legal-review content: Legal review of white-label licensing and compiled binary IP protection status: pending - id: redbean-lua-prototype content: Build minimal redbean + Lua + WASM composition proof-of-concept status: pending --- # SaaS Composition Platform - Strategic Architecture ## Executive Summary A "CMS for SaaS" platform that treats WebAssembly modules as composable content, enabling multi-tier white-labeling where each downstream tenant receives a unique, optimized binary with only their licensed features compiled in. The platform leverages authorized reseller relationships with IBM PartnerWorld and Climb Channel Solutions to embed enterprise capabilities.--- ## Core Technology Stack ### Dual Binaryen Architecture ```mermaid flowchart TB subgraph buildTime [Build-Time Layer] BinaryenCosmo[binaryen.com
Cosmopolitan Native] BuildPipeline[CI/CD Build Pipeline] ModuleRegistry[Module Registry] end subgraph runtime [Runtime Layer] Redbean[redbean.com
Universal Server] BinaryenWasm[binaryen.wasm
In-Process Optimizer] LuaOrch[Lua Orchestration] SQLite[SQLite State] end subgraph outputs [Deployment Artifacts] TenantBinary[Tenant Binary
White-Labeled] ClientBinary[Client Binary
Sub-Labeled] AgentBinary[Agent Binary
Lightweight] end ModuleRegistry --> BinaryenCosmo BinaryenCosmo --> BuildPipeline BuildPipeline --> TenantBinary TenantBinary --> Redbean BinaryenWasm --> LuaOrch LuaOrch --> ClientBinary LuaOrch --> AgentBinary ``` **Native Binaryen (Cosmopolitan Build)** - Single `binaryen.com` binary runs on Linux, macOS, Windows, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, NetBSD - Full optimization suite: `wasm-merge`, `wasm-opt`, `wasm-ctor-eval`, `wasm-metadce` - Build pipeline use: tenant binary generation, CI/CD integration - Performance target: native speed for heavy optimization passes **WASM Binaryen (Self-Hosted)** - `binaryen.wasm` runs inside redbean's WASM runtime - Enables runtime module composition without external tooling - Tenant-safe: sandboxed execution, no filesystem access - Powers: hot module swapping, dynamic feature activation, client-side preview --- ## Platform Architecture ### Module Registry Structure ```javascript /registry/ Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ native/ # Your proprietary IP Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ core/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ auth.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ billing.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ api-gateway.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ data-layer.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ verticals/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ payments/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ healthcare/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ lending/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ observability/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ grc/ Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ commerce/ Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ frameworks/ # GRC frameworks Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ soc2-type2.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ hipaa.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ ... Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ ibm/ # IBM resold modules Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ watson/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ assistant.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ discovery.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ nlp.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ watsonx/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ ai.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ governance.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ data.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ security/ Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ verify.wasm Γöé Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ guardium.wasm Γöé Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ qradar.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ sterling/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ oms.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ fulfillment.wasm Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ inventory.wasm Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ climb/ # Climb Channel resold Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ thales/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ sailpoint/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ snowflake/ Γöé Γö£ΓöÇΓöÇ hashicorp/ Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ ... Γöé ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ tenants/{tenant-id}/ # Tenant custom modules ΓööΓöÇΓöÇ custom/ ``` ### Composition Engine ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Admin as Tenant Admin participant Portal as Build Portal participant Registry as Module Registry participant Binaryen as Binaryen Engine participant Artifact as Artifact Store Admin->>Portal: Configure build (features, branding, config) Portal->>Registry: Resolve module dependencies Registry-->>Portal: Module list + entitlements Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-merge (combine modules) Binaryen-->>Portal: Merged module Portal->>Binaryen: wasm-ctor-eval (bake config) Note right of Binaryen: Brand, API keys, pricing
